title: Assistant Manager - Data Science
jobDescription:
You will be working with client relationship managers, product owners and developers to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. You will be a blend of data hacker, business analyst, coder, communicator and guide to translate terabytes of data into customer insights or usable solutions.

  • Lead and build a team of Trainee Data Scientists, Junior Data Scientists and Data Scientists
  • Pro-actively identify opportunities for application of analytics in the organization
  • Understand organization s analytical needs and convert business problems to analytical problems
  • Develop and deep understanding and intuition of our clients- and our business interests
  • Take full ownership of your and your team s work, from the initial idea-generation phase to the implementation of the final product to its maintenance and improvement
  • Execute/deliver projects independently if required
  • Transform large complex datasets from various sources (transactional, digital, logs, campaigns..)
  • Give pragmatic, actionable business / consumer insights in a well-presented manner
  • Work with cutting edge tools like GreenPlum, R, Python etc. and arrive at the best approach to solve challenging problems
  • Work with a team or independently on coding, data manipulation, integration plus deployment to production systems
  • Create marketing plans or campaign ideas and derive ideal target groups for campaigns based on various call to actions
  • Develop and automate Business Intelligence frameworks
  • Develop new algorithms for predicting or influencing consumer behavior prediction (eg: next purchase, attrition etc.) - Build, validate and deploy into production
  • Gather requirements from and present final deliverables to clients
  • Mastering the fast evolving data structure and infrastructure; Understanding constraints and troubleshooting to arrive at workarounds when required
  • Work on end-to-end data management including database design, data update processes, data pipeline set-up and enriching data quality
  • Understand and experiment with different statistical and machine learning algorithms and apply them for business problems
  • Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.
  • Independently define solve problems, research development, self-learning and skill development - Build training material and contribute to ideation and capability development in the team
  • Interview for recruitment and guide other members in the department

Experience

Candidate Profile :

  • 3 to 7 years of experience in data science or analytics with significant exposure to data mining and working on end to end projects through structured problem solving
  • Should have done hands-on work on data wrangling, analytical projects and its presentation
  • Hands-on expertise with advanced Excel. Hands-on knowledge of Tableau / Metabase is a plus
  • Hands-on expertise in data manipulation, e.g. through SQL, Python, Java/Scala or R
  • Should have expertise in multiple programming languages (Eg: Python, R, C++, Java). Prior experience in big-data technology like Hadoop, Spark etc. is a plus
  • Hands-on experience with any one scripting tool, (e.g. Python, bash/batch scripting)
  • Prior usage and knowledge of multiple machine learning frameworks or statistical techniques
  • Experience in leading a team of data scientists is preferred. Experience in client management is a plus

Skillset

  • Strong analytical skills and good aptitude in programming and logical reasoning. Should be able to structure problems through logical thinking from first principles and interpret data meaningfully
  • Proficiency in data manipulation with at least one tool is a must. SQL expertise is preferred here
  • Must be able to adapt to a fast-changing technological environment and learn new tools quickly. Should be able to experiment with various tools and techniques
  • Deep understanding of statistical and machine learning algorithms with the ability to tweak them for performance and accuracy if required. Understanding of algorithmic foundations of optimization and distributed computing is a plus
  • Expertise in data mining and data wrangling. Good knowledge of data structures and data management is a plus
  • Ability to identify and implement and improve the right models and techniques as per business needs and design, implement production-ready solutions. Prior experience in productionizing data science solutions is preferred
  • Strong sense of initiative with a go-getter attitude - ideate and experiment to identify areas with potential for improvement and come up with recommendations or solutions at work
  • Strong sense of ownership and commitment to the team s work. Should be painfully detailoriented but pragmatic and be able to coordinate multiple timelines and ensure their achievement
  • Should be efficient and effective communicator. Should be able to co-ordinate with multiple stakeholders and convey complex analysis results clearly with conviction to them. Should be able to learn from and teach others in the department. Should have excellent presentation skills

Qualification

  • B.Tech/BE/B.S from a premier institute OR -
    Masters in Mathematics / Data Science / Analytics or related field from a
    premier institute

title: Data Science Intern
jobDescription:
What are we looking for

We are looking for Data Science enthusiasts who are geeks at heart and passionate about programming and machine learning. You should have a research mindset and be willing to challenge yourself to learn everyday.

In this role, you should be highly analytical, with a knack for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data.

Your Responsibilities:
  • Help us in annotation of dataset for yolo and Name Entity Recognition(NER) models.
  • You will be trained on using image annotation tools like LabelImg and text annotation tools like doccano to serve the needs for development of our internal products.
  • Learn and implement data munging and mining using state-of-the-art methods.
  • Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner.
  • Freedom and opportunities to learn and introduce new tools, libraries and coding standards.
About you: You are an ideal fit if:
  • You have been part of any startup before or have tried to work on your own startup
  • You had been placed via the on-campus recruitment drives, but chose to do something of your own you truly, deeply and passionately believed in.
  • You have what it takes to code in real time, with very limited references using stackoverflow, google, geeksforgeeks etc
  • You have a habit of solving problems in your free time
  • You want to flex your coding skills share your github projects, assignments and Kaggle/ Hackerank profile URLs
  • You read a tech book every now and then to up-skill yourself
  • Self-motivated to proactively adapt to continuous learning
Core Skills:
  • 0-1 years of hands-on experience of data mining with semi-structured or structured data.
  • 0-1 years of hands-on experience with Python, SQL, R(Not mandatory)
  • 0-1 years of hands-on experience in using Python based machine learning packages and libraries.
  • You are willing to be trained on analysing various data forms to capture important data from it.

title: Senior Investment Risk Specialist - Data Science
jobDescription:
• Develop, execute, and maintain lending valuation model
  • Advise leadership on lending portfolio risk
  • Perform complex activities related to assessing risk exposures
  • Measure and manage fiduciary and investment risk
  • Lead the strategy and resolution of highly complex and unique challenges to proactively identify, assess, measure, monitor, control, and report on significant fiduciary and investment risks
  • Deliver solutions that are long-term, large-scale and require the most complex quantitative and analytic models to help manage credit risk
  • Make decisions regarding implementation of initiatives with moderate to high risk and partner with risk analysts in development of risk oversight strategies
  • Influence and lead risk management to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
  • Collaborate and consult with management, independent risk management, companywide risk analysts and regulatory agencies to resolve findings and develop investment risk oversight initiatives and strategies
  • Collaborate on key investment risk oversight analysis, provide on-going market monitoring for potential impacts to Wells Fargo clients, and escalate key risk topics to monthly risk oversight forums

Job Expectations:

  • Provide quantitative support for lending valuation program
  • Perform in depth reviews of investment management and risk management processes and controls, leveraging large databases and quantitative tools
  • Analyze complex findings and assess risk management effectiveness
  • Propose risk limits and recommendations as needed.
  • Develop and implement quantitative risk measures, and relevant reports to assess and monitor risk exposures
  • Implement innovative and automated solutions utilizing software tools and quantitative research to provide robust fiduciary and investment risk oversight


Required Qualifications:

  • 5 - 10 years of Investment Risk, Capital Markets, Trading, Desk Analyst, Investment Analyst, Portfolio Analyst, Investment Management Research, or Investment Services experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
    4+ years of strong experience in SQL
    Should able to execute scripts in Python (Intermediate proficiency)
  • A graduate or higher qualification in business, accounting, finance, statistics, or economics
  • Progress towards or achievement of Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) certification
  • Experience or exposure with Bloomberg, MSCI Barra and/or FactSet
  • Working experience with the investment management industry
  • Experience analyzing financial markets and/or financial instruments for risk/return purposes
  • Ability to take initiative and work independently with minimal supervision in a structured environment
  • Experience or exposure in analytics software such as Python, R or MATLAB
  • Experience in writing and maintaining SQL queries[OM1]

title: Consultant, Data Science and Analytics
jobDescription:
• You' ll help clients know everything they can about their customers and prospects, deliver exceptional customer experiences, and know if their marketing worked and how to make it better.
  • You'll help diagnose business needs, translate into questions that Neustar will answer, and architect ways to wrangle data from multiple sources.
  • You'll work closely with Neustar s data scientists and consultants to identify new insights, translate findings into the stakeholder s native language and tell stories to make complex things simple to understand and translate into measurable actions.
  • You'll implement our unified analytics solutions to address marketing effectiveness, return on investment (ROI), brand equity impact, segmentation, pricing, and environmental factors.
  • Work with senior data scientists to ensure model quality in terms of modeling methodologies, data / model validation metrics, actionable insights, and analytical/technical best practices.
  • In our Neustar proprietary analytics platform implement multi-touch attribution models (MTA) and marketing mix models (MMM) that are based on statistics, econometrics, and/or machine learning techniques such as logistic regression, choice model, time-series model, panel data model, Bayesian statistics, ridge regression, structural equations, probability theory, clustering algorithms, etc.
  • Analyze big data sets to generate deep insights on paid media, organic media, market conditions, web navigations, and individuals propensities on multi-step conversion activities in the consumer journeys.
  • Validate model results and package them into insightful client-friendly reports on ROI analysis, forecasting, simulation and optimization.
  • Ensure rigorous quality control and detect anomalies in the model with ongoing new data stream.
  • Interdisciplinary work: you ll interact with multiple teams across the firm to implement our end-to-end solutions and improve processes: Data Operations, Solution Architects, Consulting Services, Product and Engineering.

Impact You'll Make:

  • Familiarity or interest in data analytics and/or statistical concepts such as marketing mix modeling, digital attribution modeling, multivariate regression, time-series modeling, Bayesian statistics, segmentation modeling, machine learning, data mining, simulation, optimization, forecasting, and ROI analysis
  • Working knowledge of Excel, SQL, R, and Python or similar
  • Bachelor s degree (required) with mathematical or engineering background: Statistics, Data Mining, Operations Research, Econometrics, Finance, Engineering or similar
  • An effective cross functional communicator in both written and verbal skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with a large cross-functional team
  • Ability and willingness to learn in a fast paced environment and adapt to the situation
  • 1 to 3 years of quantitative analytics experience with marketing metrics and tracking is helpful but not required

Business intelligence

title: Ecom is hiring-Sr. Manager Data Science/Manager Data Science, Gurgaon
jobDescription:
Ecom Express is hiring!

Position- Senior Manager Data Science / Manager Data Science

Experience-(6-10 years)

Location- Gurgaon (Work from Office)


About Ecom Express:

Ecom Express Limited is a leading end-to-end technology enabled logistics solutions provider to the Indian e-commerce industry. Headquartered in Gurugram, Haryana, Ecom Express was incorporated in 2012 by T. A. Krishnan, Manju Dhawan, K. Satyanarayana and Late. Sanjeev Saxena with their 100+ years of cumulative experience in the Indian logistics and distribution industry. Ecom Express has its presence in all 29 states of the country and operates in over 2650+ towns across 27,000+ PIN-codes in India.



Responsibilities:

  • Strong experience and expertise in deep learning (neural networks, transformers)
  • Good understanding of computer science fundamentals
  • Ability to quickly learn and implement state-of-the-art, and the thought process of generating novel ideas
  • Fast pace execution mindset at the same time research mindset
  • Identifying and defining ML problems
  • Stakeholder management
  • Managing teams
  • Experience with operations research is a bonus

Qualifications:

  • 6-10 years (at least 4 years of experience with modern machine learning)
  • B.Tech/MS/PhD in Computer Science (or relevant fields)



  •  Q1: Do you have experience with modern deep learning models?
  • Q2: Have you created production applications using these models?
  • Q3: Did you create these models from scratch in Tensorflow or Pytorch and trained them on your data?

Why join Ecom Express?

We are one of the most exciting, innovative and fastest growing logistics companies in India. We believe in the power of people, and we encourage every employee to be their best by empowering them with a great working atmosphere and challenging working experience.

As a Group we are committed to creating a positive work culture, where employees can thrive and achieve their best. We are proud to say the Group has Great Place to Work certification (2023-2024).

This certification shows our commitment to developing a positive and supportive work environment a place where our employees have control of their careers and can develop in an inclusive, creative, responsible and collaborative workplace. We make it our priority to continuously improve our way of working together, covering integration, communication, collaboration, digital support, development, engagement, social responsibility and ultimately employee satisfaction which also leads to improved customer satisfaction.


Interested Candidates can share their CV to alice.m@ecomexpress.in

title: Assistant Manager/ Lead Assistant Manager - Data Science/SAS/Python
jobDescription:
Assistant Manager/ Lead Assistant Manager - Data Science/SAS/Python/R & Excel - BFSI

Role Overview:

- The person will be a part of the data science team for major US BFSI client

- Doing independent research, analyze, and present data as assigned

- Developing and implementing tactical criteria using SAS and Excel to improve performance of Direct mail campaigns

- Developing performance reports for Direct mail campaigns using SAS, Excel

- Developing efficient SAS codes for Direct mail campaign selections with detailed documentation of outputs

- Developing statistical models in SAS, Python/R. Develop detailed SAS/Python/R codes for data preparation and model scoring to be used in the production

- Critically examine and deep dive into models and improving model performance

- Prepare detailed documentation of models output, performance and all the steps involved

- Assist in learning and development of new team members

- Identify and participate in continuous improvement initiatives

Key Responsibilities:

- Complete understanding of business objective/problem statement for marketing campaigns

- Complete understanding of business objective/problem statement for modelling initiatives

- Experience in data extraction and data manipulation in SAS, Python/R and Excel

- Preparing detailed documentation and implementation codes of the process involved in executing Marketing campaigns

- Data exploration, data preparation (outlier treatment, missing value imputation, variable transformation etc.), model building, model validation, optimization and scoring using SAS/Python/R

- Preparing detailed documentation of models output results (of different iterations), model performance, feature importance and all the steps involved to optimize the model performance

- Adhere to project deliverables and controls

- Experience in data control and data automation

- Good written and verbal communication skills

Candidate Profile:

- Bachelor- s/Master's degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics

- 3-6 years experience, preferably in data science/marketing analytics/building predictive models

- Should be really proficient in creating efficient SAS codes for handling large datasets

- Should be really proficient in building predictive statistical models (look-alike/response models)

- Should have experience working on techniques like Logistic Regression, Decision Trees. Knowledge of Random Forest, GBM, XG-Boost, K-Means Clustering etc. is a plus point

- Superior analytical and problem-solving skills

- Ability to take initiative, quick learner and innovative

- Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

- Able to work in a fast pace continuously evolving environment and ready to take up uphill challenges

- Is able to understand cross-cultural differences and can work with clients across the globe

title: Senior Engineer - Data Science
jobDescription:
From building entire infrastructures or platforms to solving complex IT challenges, Cambridge Technology helps businesses accelerate their digital transformation and become AI-first businesses. With over 20 years of expertise as a technology services company, we enable our customers to stay ahead of the curve by helping them figure out the perfect approach, solutions, and ecosystem for their business.Our experts help customers leverage the right AI, big data, cloud solutions, and intelligent platformsthat will help them become and stay relevant in a rapidly changing world.


No Of Positions: 1


Skills required: 

  • The ideal candidate will have a bachelors degree in data science, statistics, or a related discipline with 4-8 years of experience, or a masters degree with 4-8 years of experience. A strong candidate will also possess many of the following characteristics
  • Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on achieving proof-of-concept
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts (regression, statistical tests, etc.)
  • Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning fundamentals
  • Experience with Python implementations to build ML and deep learning algorithms (e.g., pandas, numpy, sci-kit-learn, stats models, Keras, PyTorch, etc.)
  • Experience writing and debugging code in an IDE
  • Experience using managed web services (e.g., AWS, GCP, etc.)
  • Strong analytic and communications skills
  • Curiosity, flexibility, creativity, and a strong tolerance for ambiguity
  • Ability to learn new tools from documentation and internet resources
  • Ability to work from home with up to 20% travel to client sites

Roles and responsibilities :

  • You will work on a small, core team alongside other engineers and business leaders throughout Cambridge with the following responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with client-facing teams to design and build operational AI solutions for client engagements
  • Identify relevant data sources for data wrangling and EDA
  • Identify model architectures to use for client business needs
  • Build full-stack data science solutions up to MVP that can be deployed into existing client business processes or scaled up based on clear documentation
  • Present findings to teammates and key stakeholders in a clear and repeatable manner

Experience :

4-8 Years

title: Manager- Data Science
jobDescription:
Roles and Responsibilities

  • Lead a team of Data Engineers, Analysts and Data scientists to carry out following activities:
  • Connect with internal / external POC to understand the business requirements
  • Coordinate with right POC to gather all relevant data artifacts, anecdotes, and hypothesis
  • Create project plan and sprints for milestones / deliverables
  • Spin VM, create and optimize clusters for Data Science workflows
  • Create data pipelines to ingest data effectively
  • Assure the quality of data with proactive checks and resolve the gaps
  • Carry out EDA, Feature Engineering & Define performance metrics prior to run relevant ML/DL algorithms
  • Research whether similar solutions have been already developed before building ML models
  • Create optimized data models to query relevant data efficiently
  • Run relevant ML / DL algorithms for business goal seek
  • Optimize and validate these ML / DL models to scale
  • Create light applications, simulators, and scenario builders to help business consume the end outputs
  • Create test cases and test the codes pre-production for possible bugs and resolve these bugs proactively
  • Integrate and operationalize the models in client ecosystem
  • Document project artifacts and log failures and exceptions.
  • Measure, articulate impact of DS projects on business metrics and finetune the workflow based on feedbacks
Why Join Tredence?

There is a reason we are one of the fastest growing private companies in the country! You will have the opportunity to work with some of the smartest and fun-loving people in the data analytics space. You will work with the latest technologies and interface directly with the key decision stakeholders at our reputed clients, some of the largest and most innovative global business brands. Our people are our greatest asset and we value every one of them. We are an equal opportunity employer who adhere to our core values & reflect this in our day to day life. So, please come & see why were so successful in one of the most competitive and fastest growing industries in the world.

title: Manager, Data Science
jobDescription:
• Analyze and derive value from data through the application methods such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, machine learning and data visualization. In this role you will also formulate hypotheses and test them using math, statistics, visualization and predictive modeling
  • Understand business challenges, create valuable actionable insights about the data, and communicate your findings to the business. After that you will work with stakeholders to determine how to use business data for business solutions/insights
  • Enable data-driven decision making by creating custom models or prototypes from trends or patterns discerned and by underscoring implications.
  • Coordinate with other technical/functional teams to implement models and monitor results
  • Apply mathematical, statistical, predictive modelling or machine-learning techniques and with sensitivity to the limitations of the techniques. Select, acquire and integrate data for analysis.
  • Develop data hypotheses and methods, train and evaluate analytics models, share insights and findings and continues to iterate with additional data
  • Develop processes, techniques, and tools to analyze and monitor model performance while ensuring data accuracy
  • Evaluate the need for analytics, assess the problems to be solved and what internal or external data sources to use or acquire.
  • Specify and apply appropriate mathematical, statistical, predictive modelling or machine-learning techniques to analyze data, generate insights, create value and support decision making
  • Contribute to exploration and experimentation in data visualization and you will manage reviews of the benefits and value of analytics techniques and tools and recommend improvements

What you will bring

  • Strong quantitative skillset with experience in statistics and linear algebra.
  • A natural inclination toward solving complex problems
  • Knowledge/experience with statistical programming languages including R, Python, SQL, etc., to process data and gain insights from it
  • Knowledge of machine learning techniques including decision-tree learning, clustering, artificial neural networks, etc., and their pros and cons
  • Knowledge and experience in advanced statistical techniques and concepts including, regression, distribution properties, statistical testing, etc.
  • Good communication skills to promote cross-team collaboration
  • Multilingual coding knowledge/experience: Java, JavaScript, C, C++, etc.
  • Experience/knowledge in statistics and data mining techniques including random forest, GLM/regression, social network analysis, text mining, etc. Ability to use data visualization tools to showcase data for stakeholders

More about this role

  • The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying data science solutions that drives business values for stakeholders.
  • Role involves working with wide range of data, structured and unstructured, experience who have facilitated business workshops, led data science projects, and set up machine learning operations.
  • The incumbent will be in charge of managing the data science product which requires expertise above that of a typical data scientist.

What extra ingredients you will bring:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and identify data science opportunities
  • Design and implement data science models and algorithms to solve complex business problems using GCP/Azure Databricks platform
  • Collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets from various internal and external sources.
  • Streamlining data science process working with Data Engineering, and Technology teams.
  • Managing multiple analytics projects within a Function to deliver end-to-end data science solutions, creation of insights and identify patterns.
  • Develop and maintain data pipelines and infrastructure to support the data science projects
  • Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through data visualizations and presentations.
  • Stay up to date with the latest data science trends and technologies, specifically for GCP companies

Education /Certifications:

  • Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Engineering, Computational Statistics, Mathematics.

Job specific requirements:

  • Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistical modeling techniques in a in a clouds-based environment such as GCP, Azure, Amazon
  • Experience with programming languages such as Python, R, Spark
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and D3.js
  • Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles
  • Experience with GCP platforms and services such as Big Query, Cloud ML Engine, and Cloud Storage
  • Experience in configuring and setting up the version control on Code, Data, and Machine Learning Models using GitHub.
  • Self-driven, be able to work with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment, adaptability to the changing business needs.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Working knowledge with application architecture, data security and compliance team

title: Data Science Manager
tagsAndSkills: project management,data science,process,data analysis,machine learning,languages,sql,interpersonal skills
jobDescription:
In this role, you will be responsible for identifying and building actionable data analysis and insights across Stocktwits various product and business lines. You will work closely with senior leadership, product managers, designers, and engineers to ultimately have a direct impact on Stocktwits product success.

What You ll Do

  • Launch our data science efforts
  • Work with large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends from our large community
  • Develop and maintain predictive models using machine learning techniques
  • Conduct statistical analysis to understand trends and patterns in data
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize data-driven projects to deliver value to the Stocktwits community
  • Communicate findings and recommendations to key stakeholders through reports and visualizations
  • Train internal stakeholders on principles used to develop models and how to leverage models to facilitate their business processes
  • Continuously improve and optimize data analysis processes and tools

What You ll Need

  • 4+ years of experience in data science
  • Bachelor s or Masters in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science)
  • Strong programming skills, particularly in Python and SQL
  • Experience with big data technologies preferred
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow)
  • Experience with natural language processing (NLP) preferred
  • Experience working with financial data preferred
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Organizational and project management skills with a demonstrated ability to balance numerous projects while meeting tight deadlines
  • Attention to Detail
  • Effective interpersonal skills, particularly in building relationships and working collaboratively both internally and externally
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
  • Proficient in English with strong written and verbal communication skills (grammar syntax)

Qualities We Look For

  • Craftsmanship: Simply put, you give a shit about the work you do and have empathy for who you do it with and for.
  • Always Learning: Your thirst for knowledge, new challenges and bettering yourself never ends personally and professionally.
  • Impactful: You want to make an impact at scale and recognize that consistent, regular execution is how you get there. As we like to say, small wins equal big things!
  • Hunger for Success: You bring a deep desire to succeed with a sense of controlled urgency.

title: Data Science Manager
jobDescription:
JOB DETAILS
  • We are urgently looking for a Data Science Manager to head our growing data science team.
  • You will join a team dedicated to creating a data driven culture and improving the efficiency and dependability of the way we make decisions.
  • Our data scientists develop algorithms that enhance the collection process for our consumers, lead automation initiatives in the company, and help create insights to better understand our product and performance.
  • We re looking for a driven, hands-on data science manager to lead, mentor, and manage contributors on the team.
  • You should have an excellent grasp of core machine learning techniques and a product-focused mindset, as well as a track record of growing and empowering data scientists to drive business value through modeling and experimentation.

    Key Responsibilities:

o Build and lead the data science team to deliver world-class products.
o Oversee the development of data science models from conducting code reviews to supporting launches while keeping the team accountable and impactful.
o Give data scientists the tools and motivation to build predictive models that lead to business impact.
o Apply data and algorithmic thinking to address business and domain problems.
o Work cross-functionally with other engineering teams and Product Management to solve problems, identify trends and opportunities.
o Lead the technical strategy of the data science team.
o Roll up your sleeves to code, build, and integrate models as necessary.

You have:
o Previous experience as manager of data scientists and machine learning engineers
o Hands-on experience with machine learning tools, techniques, and framework
o Experience with building and productizing models, and iterating and improving them over time
o Experience with advising leadership on decisions related to your field and expertise
o Ability and desire to educate the rest of the company in data science concepts and techniques
o Advanced degree in statistics, applied mathematics, computer science or equivalent
o Strong quantitative and analytical skills as well as experience strong foundational skills in Python, pandas, and SQL

Ideally, you also have:
o Solid understanding of experiment design
o Experience with natural language processing techniques
o FinTech background

Job Profile
Looking for a Data Science leader to help us build our Data Science organization. You will
collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers and analysts on a wide range of problems, bringing
scientific thought and statistical methods to leverage the vast amount of data. Ultimately enabling the
product team to build, develop and improve products that will revolutionize the energy industry.
To be successful in this role, you should possess
Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Engineering,
Mathematics, or other business/analytical disciplines.
5+ years data science and analytics experience. Strong project management and leadership skills.
Demonstrated ability to build processes and implement tools from the ground-up.
Ability to coach and mentor analysts on technical and analytical skills.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up
assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.
Ability to employ statistics and anomaly detection techniques for data-driven analytics.
Ability to process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis and modeling.
Solid experience with common data science toolkits, such as scikit-learn, Spark ML, pandas, Scipy,
etc.
Strong SQL knowledge; working experience with standard Business Intelligence tools a great plus.
Experience dealing with large quantities of data across relational and NoSQL databases, cloud
storage, and distributed compute systems.
Ability to scale data science solutions with a keen understanding of how to optimize performance
and mitigate computing cost.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Ability to rethink existing processes and design new processes for more effective analyses.
Good knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
Excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively
communicate with both business and technical teams.


  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for presenting findings to technical and
    non-technical audiences.

    Build a Data Science organization, allowing the company to harness the power of data in
    developing and marketing new products.
    Mentor a team of analysts.
    Liaise with Product and Business Leaders to understand issues, priorities and support them
    through relevant product and business analytics.
    Deliver data backed analysis and statistically proven solutions.
    Ability to work across time zones in a dynamic start-up setting.
    Analyzing vast amounts of data to identify patterns and create thought leadership on customer
    usage patterns and rates.
    Good to have/Preferred Qualifications:
    Experience in the utility or energy industries.
    Experience working with a start-up.
    Additional Project/Soft Skills:
    Should be able to work independently with India & US based team members.
    Strong verbal and written communication with ability to articulate problems and solutions over
    phone and emails.
    Strong sense of urgency, with a passion for accuracy and timeliness.
    Ability to work calmly in high pressure situations and manage multiple projects/tasks.
    Ability to work independently and possess superior skills in issue resolution.
    Benefits & working
    Comprehensive health and accident insurance
    Attractive compensation with exceptional Bonus/Profit share opportunities
    Creative, flexible and rewarding work environment
    You will work with a founding team of serial entrepreneurs with multiple successful exits to their
    credit. The learning will be immense just as will the challenges!
    This is the right time to join us and partner in our early growth.

For further assistance, please share your CV to n.chiranjeevi@nityo.com


Thank and regards,


Chiranjeevi Nanjunda - Talent acquisition.

title: Engineer III Consultants-Data Science
jobDescription:
• Reducing Fraud loss and customer friction involving hands-on data analysis, Machine Learning modeling and other standard data science techniques.
  • Translating real world problems into solvable Machine Learning problems leading to actionable insights. Responding rapidly to emerging threats, both internal and external, with proactive monitoring and swift deployment of new controls.
  • Engaging with business partners and collaborating with cross functional teams to define and evaluate business problems, design and implement effective, innovative analytical solutions and models with the right choice of technology and level of complexity for the business challenges.
  • Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in large complex data sets.
  • Translating data into insights and utilize that to implement solutions for business problems.
  • Designing and developing ML based anomaly detection and chart overlays.
  • Developing strategies for effective reporting, use graphs, infographics and other tools to visualize data.
  • Monitoring analytics and metrics results and take action.
  • Building tools and frameworks to automate data collection.

You'll need to have:

  • Bachelors degree or four or more years of work experience.
  • Four or more years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience in Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning, Consulting Reporting, and Business Development.
  • Experience of the following modelling techniques: Linear Regression, Logistic Regression(Binomial and Multi-Class), Robust Regression, DBSCAN, Text Analytics (NLP), 3-DimensionalTensor Factorization, Time-Series Analysis, Clustering, Holt-Winter s Forecasting Technique, Decision Tree Analysis, Boosted Decision Tree Analysis, CNN s like Resnet, Inception.

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

  • Masters degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science.
  • Four or more years of experience as data scientist (experience on wide array of domains).
  • Knowledge in risk management and/or modelling experience.
  • Experience with AWS.
  • Experience in statistics.
  • Experience in graph DB knowledge.
  • Knowledge in the following programming Language(s): Experience in combinations of SAS, SQL, R, Python, Java.
  • Experience in OS and/or HW: Linux/Unix open systems, AWS environment.
  • Skills with communication to present complex ideas and concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Experience in writing SQL, stored procedures, query performance tuning preferably on Oracle, PostgreSQL.
  • Knowledge in business intelligence tools like Qlik, ELK.
  • Knowledge of Python (including packages like SciKitLearn, numpy, pandas).
  • Experience in at least one-Postgres, Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata

title: Engineer III Consultants-Data Science
jobDescription:
You will be a strategic thinker joining a high profile, high visibility team that powers analytics and strategic thinking for Verizon. You will be part of a team that builds tools, analyses, and insights that informs, quantifies, and enables the visualization of data to drive business decisions for all of Verizon s Networks. With your analytical, big data and reporting expertise, you will deliver business value through business intelligence reporting and analytics by driving insights to actions. One way you will accomplish this is by developing analytical views of data utilizing various BI tools such as Tableau, Qlik, and web-based applications. You ll also connect various data locations to stage data before visualizations. The business insights and recommendations you provide will help to improve Verizon s performance.

  • Performing ad-hoc analysis and developing reproducible analytical approaches to meet business requirements.
  • Performing exploratory and targeted data analyses using descriptive statistics and other methods.
  • Performing geospatial analyses and creating geospatial visualizations to respond to business requests.
  • Presenting results and recommendations to senior management and business users.
  • Collaborating with business leads and GTS to execute all visual design phases from concept and requirements to final hand-off to business unit end-users.
  • Detailing and demonstrating solutions by developing wireframes, production documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, and models.

You ll need to have:

  • Bachelor s degree or four or more years of work experience.
  • Four or more years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience in geospatial analytics.
  • Knowledge of wireless and wireline network fundamentals.
  • Experience in applying statistical ideas and methods to data sets to answer business problems.
  • Experience in visual science/ dashboard design principles.
  • Experience in Python, Spark, and SQL to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience in developing insights, presenting, and influencing strategic decisions using data.

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

  • Masters of Science in Computer Science, Engineering or technical field.
  • Knowledge of data science.
  • Experience in process, data, and automation work.
  • Experience in Google Cloud Platform.
  • Experience in Alteryx or similar ETL/geospatial tools.
  • Knowledge of Data Engineering techniques.
  • Ability to present complex or technical topics in an engaging way.

title: Mgr-Data Science
jobDescription:
• Lead the ideation and launch of innovative AI/ML capabilities services
  • Hands on Deep learning Algorithms like BERT, RNN, LSTM, Transformer, GRU, GAN etc
  • Working with MLOPs capability like MLFlow, AirFlow etc and understanding of deployment capabilities on public cloud (AWS, GCP) and on-prem infrastructure
  • Technically hands-on working with big data sets using Python/JAVA/SPARK, doing EDA and bringing insights from data
  • Building POCs basis on research papers analysis while simulating business impact and Transform MVPs to production grade capabilities in collaboration with engineering teams
  • Authoring and publishing papers, adopting open source tools, presenting in conferences, conducting RD driving company revenue.
  • Innovate ways to evangelize the product to drive Amex wide user adoption
  • Contribute to the strategy and roadmap of AI/ML Initiatives to help drive most impact
  • Evaluate prospective features in AI Services and ability to prioritise them with changing requirements in the direction of AI adoptions.

Leadership Outcomes:

  • Lead with an external perspective, challenge status quo and bring continuous innovation to our existing offerings
  • Demonstrate learning agility, make decisions quickly and with the highest level of integrity
  • Lead with a digital mindset and deliver the world’s best customer experiences every day

Past Experience:

  • 5 years of building machine learning models using advance AI techniques
  • 3-4 years of experience in working with product/engineering/automation development teams in a fast paced, complex, and dynamic environment.
  • Experience in leveraging Agile, Scrum or other rapid application development methodologies

Academic Background:

Undergraduate/Master’s/PHD in Computer Science/ Data Science/ Statistics/ Mathematics, MBA from institutes of global repute.

Functional Skills:

  • Ability experience in taking a prototype to a product stage
  • Different aspects of research and development
  • Strong quantitative, analytical, and structured problem-solving skills.
  • Demonstrate creativity and self-sufficiency along with strong interpersonal/ collaborative skills and experience working in global teams
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Experience defining and developing a new product or service.

Technical Skills:

  • Good coding skills in Python, SPARK, Hive, GIT
  • Good Understand of Deep Learning Algorithms
  • Superior math programming skills and hands-on experience in machine learning tools
  • Understanding of how CI/CD works
  • Exposure to Public Cloud Deployment (AWS, GCP)
  • Proficient in statistical techniques
  • Background in Natural Language Processing

Knowledge of Platforms:

Knowledge of Big Data Platforms such as Hadoop , SQL is preferred

Behavioural Areas:

Enterprise Leadership Behaviours

  • Set The Agenda: Put Enterprise Thinking First, Lead with an External Perspective
  • Bring Others with You: Build the Best Team, Seek Provide Coaching Feedback, Make Collaboration Essential
  • Do It the Right Way: Communicate Frequently, Candidly Clearly, Make Decisions Quickly Effectively, Live the Blue Box Values, Great Leadership Demands Courage

title: Data Analyst - CRM Platform
placeholders: [{"type":"experience","label":"1-6 Yrs"},{"type":"salary","label":"Not disclosed"},{"type":"location","label":"Kolkata, Mumbai, Hyderabad/Secunderabad, Pune, Ahmedabad, Chennai, Delhi / NCR, Bangalore/Bengaluru"}]
jobDescription:
Responsibilities :

- Work cross-functionally to resolve known data quality problems in our CRM platform to support key business functions such as sales operations, customer support, marketing, order management, and business intelligence.

- Clean and enrich data using internal data upload tools.

- Analyze data and identify patterns and trends causing data issues.

- Create documentation around data management based on changing business definitionsprocesses and keep existing documents up to date on a monthly basis.

- Build dashboards and reports using internal tools to track key business metrics and internal data quality team metrics.

- Work on strategic projects to improve overall data quality in our CRM & MDM platforms.

Minimum Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree or equivalent

- 1-2 years experience in data analytics

- Advanced Google SpreadsheetsMicrosoft Excel skills

- Ability to follow a detailed set of instructions and rule sets

- Fast learner

- Intermediate SQL skills

- Able to work both as a team or independently

- Familiarity with Salesforce

- Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications :

- Experience with Salesforce or any CRM platform.

- Prior programming experience in any major programming language: Python, Java, C++, etc

- Strong communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams.

- Strong analytical and problem solving skills, and high attention to detail.

- Eager to develop new knowledge and expertise.

- Self-motivated to dig into data.

- Advanced SQL skills.
location: Kolkata, Mumbai, Hyderabad/Secunderabad, Pune, Ahmedabad, Chennai, Delhi / NCR, Bangalore/Bengaluru

title: Senior Data Scientist
jobDescription:
Your Role and Responsibilities
As Build Labs Team Senior Data Scientist, you will support the creation of cloud applications that work smarter and more effectively by infusing data science workflows to extract business insights from data. These insights will drive increased value - for many of the biggest and most complex ISV partner applications. You will work with a team of engineers with expertise in industry-leading Cloud platforms and technologies to implement these transformations.

To succeed, you will become a trusted collaborator with ISV partner developers and data scientists as they move their technologies and offerings to IBM software solutions across multi-cloud platforms. You will have an opportunity to consult and provide guidance to ISV partners as they integrate their products, services and offerings to IBM software solutions across multi-cloud platforms.

This role will interface with marketing, expert services, development, other IBM delivery organizations and business development leaders to ensure successful outcomes. Candidates must be comfortable working in a dynamic and rapidly evolving agile work environment.

This is an opportunity for you to help IBM and external partners succeed in growing cloud presence.
As a Data Scientist on the Build Labs team, you will:

  • Assist partners in defining, designing, implementing and deploying machine learning technologies in their product
  • Participate in engagements with partners
  • Enable partners on IBM s Data/AI technologies, products
  • Effectively lead projects with multiple technical teams and IBM Partners across geographies
  • Capture best practices for ML, Data/AI technologies, create documentation like articles, tutorials, and hands-on workshops & demos
  • Demonstrate your passion to understand and learn new technologies, to innovate and improve quality of service

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
8+ experience with Data science or data engineering projects

  • Experience working on engagements for data science, conceptualisation of use cases and experience in design, build, train and deploy ML components. Strong Foundation in Statistics and machine learning algorithms.
  • Expertise working with open source packages in NLP, Timeseries etc.
  • Expertise with development in a data science programming language like Python or R
  • Experience running and statistically evaluating models used in Machine Learning, Optimization, Neural Networks
  • Experience with ETL tools & Data warehouses
  • Experience using SQL and good RDBMS conceptual knowledge
  • Experience in Data and AI offerings on Public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google etc.)
  • Experience with ADO or Jenkins for CI/CD- Must have one or more of the following customer-facing roles in work history:
  • Understanding of data science open source technologies including Python, Jupyter notebooks, Pytorch , TensorFlow and Spark
  • Professional/lab services, technical sales, support, ISV, or business partner focal
  • Successful completion of a delivered customer project as a developer or data specialist
  • Comfortable interacting with ISV and/or external customer
  • You should be familiar with IBM software solutions across multi-cloud platforms and Red Hat OpenShift platforms or other public cloud platforms.
  • Ability to understand and learn new technologies quickly
  • Must exhibit excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Background

  • Master s Degree in Stats or Maths

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

  • 6+ years of experience in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Spark)
  • Expertise with Jupyter notebooks
  • Experience with deep learning models using Keras
  • Deep Understanding of Statistical Machine Learning Models with Python or R
  • Experience with Watson Studio and IBM AI API
  • Understanding of data science open source technologies including Python, Jupyter notebooks, TensorFlow, and Spark
  • Big Data Certifications on Cloudera/ Hortonworks/ AWS/ GCP/ Azure
  • Experience with AI Fairness 360 toolkit and/or Watson OpenScale
  • Experience with IBM software solutions across multi-cloud platforms Pak for Data
  • Experience as a client or ISV developer advocate
  • Experience in Data and AI offerings on Public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google etc.)
  • Experience with Databases and Data engineering

title: Data Science & Analytics
jobDescription:
The role is expected to use analytical tools to identify opportunities to grow overall assets as well as identify opportunities to manage risk. The role is therefore expected to define risk management framework across client lifecycle acquisition, portfolio management and collections; across retail lending products catering to Retail, SME segments.
Ongoing identification of opportunities to grow assets on the back of digital acquisition models enabled by advanced analytics.
Identification of opportunities to mitigate risk and attain risk cost benchmarks as stipulated across portfolios.
Publish monthly portfolio thematic with heatmap and conduct reviews on the same with relevant stakeholders from Business and Risk to align on opportunities to grow business and mitigate risk.
Evaluate partnership opportunities in various models aggregator led, co-lending, etc and monitor and manage portfolio originated with partners on an ongoing basis in collaboration with various business units .
Incorporate alternate data on an ongoing basis to strengthen fraud and risk management framework as well as collaborate with fintechs in the domain of artificial intelligence and advanced analytics to improve efficacy of models scorecards.
Lead development of new risk scorecards for new and existing products.
Build advanced analytical decision engines for underwriting and cross-sell leveraging traditional regression or machine learning or alternative data led models.
Design analytical Collections / Early Warning System strategies e.g. segment-based Collections strategies, settlement scorecards, loan restructuring approach, limit modification approach, etc.
Collaborate across other functions (e.g. Risk, Technology, Product Business teams) to implement the analytical decisions .
Provide ongoing guidance and coaching to data scientists in the team, ensure timely training and skills improvement of the team.
Support in regulatory reporting .

title: Senior Advisory Data Scientist
jobDescription:
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

  • 7-10+ years of hands-on experience in the Analytics ecosystem including:
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience with SQL and Python
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Ray) and deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras)
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with DevOps/MLOps frameworks (Git, CI/CD, Docker, MLFlow, Argo)
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience building libraries and packages to be re-used by others
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience building DS Solutions for production usage
  • Team player with a problem-solving attitude
  • Experience in leading & delivering advanced analytical projects to large, complex organizations in a multi-functional environment
  • Able to challenge and review the quality and value generated from analytical outputs
  • Focus on driving business value for business clients to support long-term relationships.
  • Ability to grow teams, ensuring the culture and strategy are communicated and maintained.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

  • Overall 10 - 12 + years of experience
  • Recognized expert in vision, language models, optimization, or advanced machine learning techniques
  • Experience in applications of AI in Supply Chain, reliability engineering, IOT, or environmental science areas
  • Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to different audiences
  • Experience leading a large-scale analytical asset or portfolio of analytics assets
  • Build and maintain executive-level relationships advising them on technical domains
  • Experience leading data science development for new products/engagements, including technical framework setting, proofs of concepts, and achieving stakeholder buy-in
  • Contributions to professional and academic communities
  • Experience mentoring and coaching other data scientists

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

  • Should be able to provide guidance on technical issues, define and manage algorithmic items and provide overall direction on research and development activities for the project.

title: Data Scientist, Growth and Data Products
jobDescription:
We re looking for a data scientist who can work with the CDO s strategy office of Dow Jones to strategize and support the execution of data-driven projects and initiatives across Dow Jones.

You will report to the VP, Growth and New Data Products, and will be responsible for conceptualizing and piloting innovative Data and AI use cases for all of Dow Jones. You will be working with the CDO s strategy office including team of business analysts and data engineering team.

To do this job, you ll need to be:

  • An excellent communicator - acting as a data scientist, you will be the bridge between the business and engineering arms of the organization. You must be able to communicate highly-technical details to senior business stakeholders, and phrase business goals in technical terms. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must.

  • Technical - you won t only be communicating back and forth, but often will be part of building data-driven solutions yourself. Familiarity with software engineering is necessary, and experience with data-related software engineering (e.g. Python, R, SQL, etc) is preferred.

  • Business Value oriented - you will need to be excellent in quantifying value benefits from various data team initiatives and explain the return on data investments that Dow Jones makes. You must be able to architect value from all potential use cases and make sure the estimated value is delivered from the data products.

  • Have a minimum of 3 years experience working at the intersection of business and data with a technology focus.

  • Knowledgeable in data solutions relating to B2B and B2C digital products, marketing, and services is a strong plus.

Responsibilities for this role include:

  • Conceptualize various innovative data initiatives and use cases across media and entertainment industry that can be applied to Dow Jones

  • Work with data engineering team to elaborate and obtain data required to validate hypothesis from each use case

  • Help run pilot on hypothesis and justify business value

  • Architect value from these initiatives and create a compelling value story to enable funding for execution of the use cases


Here are some things that wed prefer to see, though none is independently a requirement:

  • Bachelor s degree / Master s degree in data sciences

  • Data science experience in media and entertainment industry

  • Great powerpoint, storyboarding and excel skills

  • Experience with working with senior leadership

title: Sr Analyst - Data & Analytics
jobDescription:
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing creative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Every day, our more than 130,000 employees across the world are blending heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity.

At Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, we are using our breadth, scale and experience to reimagine the way healthcare can be delivered and help people live longer, healthier lives. In a radically changing environment, we are making connections across science and technology to combine our own expertise in surgery, Orthopedics, vision and interventional solutions with the big ideas of others to design and deliver physician and patient-centric products and solutions. As pioneers in medical devices, we continually focus on elevating the standard of care-working to expand patient access, improve outcomes, reduce health system costs and drive value. We create people-centered healthcare to help the patients we serve recover faster and live longer and more vibrantly.

In India, Johnson & Johnson operates as a single legal entity and consists of the 3 strategic business units: Consumer Products, Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices & Diagnostics, which are independently managed and report into their respective Global business segments.

J&J Medical India (JJMI) is the market leader in the Medical Company Devices & Diagnostics Industry in India. It is in the business of caring and providing solutions to doctors, patients and nurses. It comprises of multiple Franchises (Strategic business units) providing healthcare solutions across Vision Care, Orthopaedics, Infection Prevention, Wound Management, Women's health, minimally invasive surgery, Circulatory disease management.

Job Description- Sr. Analyst - Data & Analytics, MedTech Commercial Excellence

We are seeking a highly motivated Sr Analyst to join our team of analytics experts in the MedTech Commercial Excellence Data & Analytics group. This position is responsible to develop visualization and analytical solutions from multiple data sources including sales, market share, innovation portfolio and other key metrics. This role is also responsible for operations and driving efficiencies. Candidate should be a strong team player and have a consultative approach to problem solving.

Key Responsibilities:

• Partner with Global Commercial teams and technology teams to build and maintain analytical solutions for use in dashboards

• Design and construct effective and reliable analytical solutions with end-to-end project responsibility by closely collaborating with business teams

• Build Tableau-based visualization dashboards for analysis of WW metrics • Own consistent data refreshes to ensure accurate up-to-date information is available

• As needed, collaborate with markets including working with local commercial operations and regions on account-level analytics, customer segmentation and deep dive analytics

• Lead Training sessions for cross-functional teams to encourage adoption of new analytical tools.Minimum Qualifications:

• Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or related STEM discipline is required

• Minimum of five (5) years of progressive experience in data visualization, database management and analytics

• Demonstrated expertise and development experience in Tableau dashboards is required

• Experience in advanced SQL; Python programming is a plus

• Experience working with cloud technologies i.e. AWS, Azure or similar • Proven ability to synthesize data, interpret data, and process observations into actionable recommendations

• Proven knowledge/use of the latest analytical models and tools

• Global experience a plus

• Proven ability to work collaboratively with colleagues across functional areas to deliver results

• Effective communication & presentation skills Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Are you ready to impact the world?

Johnson & Johnson offers an unusual experience to professionals looking for an opportunity to work with hardworking people who share your real passion for caring in an environment that empowers you to drive your own career.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

title: Data Scientist - Chennai
jobDescription:
• Name of Vertical/Horizontal: Smart Cities

• Project Name: Ahmedabad Smart City

• Name of Position: Data Scientist

• Location: Ahmedabad

• Tentative Start Date: May-2023

• Tentative End date: March-2028

• Reports to: Head Product Engineering

• Brief about Project:

• About the Role

  • We are looking for Data Scientist who can collect, create, analyse various data, develop, and validate model and solutions for the ITS. Handle Big data, do statistical analysis for the possible solution.
  • Responsibilities
  • Understand the Functional specifications & derive AI / ML / Statistical specifications
  • Exploratory Data Analysis with Python or any available statistical platforms to understand the summary statistics, Distribution of the dataset, Outlier detection / detection of influencing observations etc.,
  • Data Imputation & Cleansing the data through industry best statistical practices
  • Data Collection both internally and from public domains
  • Feature engineering, identify the relevant attributes / features
  • Building the models to solve the industry problems with reasonable accuracy to fit for use in production
  • Identify and understand the Diagnostics of Models to know the stability of the model(s) in stressed conditions
  • Validate the model and fine-tuning the model on continual basis
  • Model deployment under given framework
  • Coordinate with our technology partners / vendors to build the best-in-class AI / ML based solutions
  • Develop and maintain strong product knowledge.
  • Stay abreast with new innovations and the latest technology trends and explore ways of leveraging these for improving the product in alignment with the business.

• Qualifications/Skills

  • Experience:

BE/B. Tech in Computer Science / MCA / MSc. Statistics with Deep Software Exposure

10+ years as Data Scientist in high performing scalable environment of ICT (or) Smart City projects.

Experience in Q-Learning / Reinforcement learning, Computer Vision (Video / Image Analytics)

Experience in Operational Research Models (Linear / Non-Linear programming)

  • Must have skills:
  • Extensive knowledge on Supervised and Unsupervised learning models
  • Good exposure on Deep learning models like MLP, CNN, RNN, LSTM etc.,
  • Good Experience in Operational Research models, liner and non-liner programming
  • Experience in statistical methods and models
  • Experience in TEXT analytics in the space of NLP, NLP, POS Tagging
  • Exposure to Conversational platform like Chatbot
  • Exposure working in GPU environment along with CPU
  • Exposure in building APIs to expose models for inference
  • Good knowledge on GitHub for source control
  • Good understand of data annotation tools
  • Data visualization experience with tools like Grafana / Dash / Streamlit etc.,
  • Data Science end-to-end exposure from data ingestion to model development to model deployment
  • Exposure working in both stand-alone and distributed environment
  • Geo tagging of physical assets and perform optimization techniques
  • Exposure working in Physical Data Center and Cloud platforms
  • Good Experience in using languages like Python, Spark on Python, R and other statistical / Machine learning languages
  • Exposure to BigData / Hadoop environment
  • Extensive experience in Model building, Validation / Diagnostics and Deployment
  • Experience in working on large volumes of data like Multi Peta bytes and variety of data
  • Strong problem solving and logical skills & A Go-getter kind of attitude
  • Preferable:
  • Should have experience as Data Scientist in high performing scalable environment of ICT (or) Smart City projects.

title: Principal Data Scientist (Principal Engineer Data Science)
companyName: Harman Connected Services Corporation India Pvt.
jobDescription:
You are a passionate AI professional, who is enthusiastic about automotive electronics and wants to define the future in-cabin user experience.

Join our Automotive AI Lab as Data Scientist. The Data Scientist will generate insights by applying analytical methods, statistical modeling, and machine learning algorithms to analyze, and interpret vehicle data, user behavior, and context information for our OTA (Over-the-Air update) products. Collaborating with global automotive and AI/ML expert teams, you will implement solutions for a compelling vehicle software update experience for OEM customers and end-consumers.

Responsibilities:

Conceptualize and design AI/ML solutions that optimize OTA campaign success and delivery algorithms

Mine and analyze large structured and unstructured datasets of vehicle, user, and context information

Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of data sources and data gathering techniques

Identify data correlations and select existing or develop custom models/algorithms

Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy

Minimum Qualification:

Masters degree in computer science or comparable practical experience

8 years of industry experience with 4 years of experience in applied data science, and big data technologies

Experience in developing AI/ML analytics applications like OTA, predictive maintenance, recommendation systems

Relevant practical experience with selected AI/ML tech stacks, tool chains, data collection, synthetic data and simulators (e.g. PyTorch, Kafka, Apache Spark, Python, R)

Preferred Qualification:

Experience working with automotive services or products

Proficient coding capability in Java

Experience in production-grade ML workflows

What Makes You Eligible:

Willingness to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel

Be willing to work in an office or home office in Bengaluru, India

title: Senior Data Scientist
tagsAndSkills: data scientist,languages,statistical modeling,natural language processing,data,data science,processing,process
jobDescription:
Dear Candidate


Hindustan Unilever Limited is looking out to hire Senior Data Scientist for their Bangalore location.


The Senior Data Scientist is an exciting role in the Data Science Centre of Excellence (CoE) team within D&A. This team builds state of the art machine learning algorithms, maximising the impact of D&As solutions in driving enterprise performance. Typical initiatives include optimizing trade promotion investments, accurately forecasting customer demand, using NLP to glean insight on consumer trends from search data, and making individual assortment recommendations for each of the millions of stores that sell Unilever products. The role will work closely with a D&A functional team such as Customer Development or Supply Chain along with business stakeholders, addressing both large transformation programs and near-term business problems.


Please find below the required skills:


Key Skills Required

  • Machine learning
  • Statistical modelling
  • Forecasting
  • Python coding Fully Operational
  • Data science platform tools e.g. MS Azure, Databricks Fully Operational
  • Deep learning (and applications to NLP & Computer Vision) Fully Operational
  • Collaborative development using Git repos

Foundational knowledge

  • Optimisation techniques and tools Foundational knowledge
  • Automated Machine Learning platforms Foundational knowledge

Relevant Experience:

  • Minimum of B.S. in a relevant technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Operations Research); preferably a postgraduate (Masters or Doctorate) degree
  • Overall 5-8 years building data science solutions to solve business problems (less experience may be acceptable if balanced by strong post-grad qualifications)
  • Experience with open source languages (eg. Python) and preferably with distributed computing (e.g. PySpark)
  • Experience deploying solutions in a modern cloud-based architecture
  • Experience managing the work of team members and 3rd party resource vendors
  • Experience presenting insights and influencing decisions of senior non-technical stakeholders

If you find this role interesting please share your update resume to dorsal.ruffina@weareams.com.


P.S. Not looking for a new opportunity? We love referrals! Introduce us via email and well take it from there.

title: Sr. Data Analyst, Rider Verticals
jobDescription:
• Refine ambiguous questions and generate new hypotheses about the product through a deep understanding of the data, our customers, and our business
  • Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and impactful conclusions.
  • Define how our teams measure success, by developing Key Performance Indicators and other users/business metrics, in close partnership with Product and other subject areas such as engineering, operations and marketing
  • Collaborate with applied scientists and engineers to build and improve on the availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability of data logging and data pipelines.
  • Develop data-driven business insights and work with cross-functional partners to find opportunities and recommend prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiatives.

---- What You Will Need --

  • Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields.
  • 5+ years experience as a Product Analyst, Sr. Data Analyst, or other types of data analysis-focused functions
  • Advanced SQL expertise
  • Experience with either Python or R for data analysis
  • Basic knowledge of statistics
  • Proven track record to wrangle large datasets, extract insights from data, and summarize learnings/takeaways.
  • Experience with Excel and some dashboarding/data visualization (i.e. Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar)
  • Proven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data
  • Excellent understanding of statistical principles backed by an academic foundation
  • Ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies for data collection and analysis
  • Ability to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail
  • Ability to work in a self-guided manner
  • Ability to mentor, coach and develop junior team members
  • Superb communication and organization skills
