title: Manager - HR & Corporate Functions Data & Analytics Engineering
jobDescription:
1. Maintain and enhance the design of the existing on-premise and cloud-based HR & Corporate Functions Data Lakes, Informatica power center data flows, Oracle RDBMS programming, SnowFlake ELT programming, Unix shell scripts, Business Objects reports, Tableau Visualizations, and People Analytics visualizations
2. Manage a team of vendor developers that will deliver technical enhancements within the HR & Corporate Functions Domains (HR, Learning, Legal, Compliance, and Corporate Affairs).
3. Design automated solutions for building, testing, monitoring, and deploying ETL and ELT solutions.
4. Analyze existing and new data sources and new systems and tools to enable the teams to consume and understand data more intuitively
5. Coordinate with source systems engineering teams to analyze data to improve efficiency, performance as well maintain elevated levels of data quality and data consistency.
6. Perform root cause analysis and resolve Level 3 production and data issues
7. Create and validate test plans, test scripts and perform data validation
8. Tune SQL queries, reports and ETL pipelines
9. Build and maintain data dictionary and process documentation
10. Present solutions to leadership, management, architects, and developers.
11. Lead cloud data engineering staff, and partner with project managers, and analysts to deliver insights to the business
12. Provide hands-on technical and thought leadership across development, product management, operations, and engineering management through effective communication. Actively develop mentoring relationships within or across teams to help others further their careers
13. Applies analytical and problem-solving experience with large-scale platforms, infrastructure, and organizations.
14. Work with Analytics enablement teams to enhance and deploy new analytics capabilities in support of the broader mission to democratize data and analytics assets within the HR & Corporate Functions domains

Basic Qualifications:

  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related field
  • Experience in the Human Resources field with a specific focus on People Data & People Data Engineering, Human Resources Reporting, and Workforce Analytics is required.
  • Strong Experience in traditional and modern data engineering such as Informatica Power Center, IICS, SnowFlake, Oracle RDBMS programming, Unix shell scripting, Python, etc is required
  • 5+ years of experience in Data warehousing, data modeling, and data transformation is required.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer / 3+ years of experience as a Data Architect is required.
  • Experienced with data preparation and ETL: Informatica, Talend, Alteryx, Dataiku etc is required.
  • Deep understanding of Cloud data warehouse solutions (Snowflake, Redshift, Spark, etc) is required.
  • 5+ years of experience designing complex, integrated and interdependent data models for analytic, Machine learning use cases.
  • Deep understanding and experience of AWS Cloud stack and (EC2, S3, Glue, Data Pipeline, Redshift) or Google Cloud Platform is required.
  • Demonstrated project management experience in owning and managing a significant organizational or data engineering and analytics project budget focusing on data engineering ($200K to $1MM annually)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • People Analytics experience using SaaS tools such as Visier, One Model, Perceptyx, Workday Prism Analytics, Workday People Analytics, SAP Success Factors Workforce Analytics is a big plus. Familiarity with cloud/SaaS-based Human Capital Management (HCM) systems such as Workday is a big plus.
  • Experience with Global HR data integration and prior experience with Mergers, Acquisitions, and Divestitures is a plus.
  • Familiarity with EU Global Data Privacy Regulations (GDPR) and other related international regulations is nice to have. Prior experience with data architecture designs and data engineering development related to the GDPR and data privacy guiding principles such as data minimization, right to be forgotten, etc is nice to have.
  • Experience in developing and deploying data and analytics services such as recommendation engines
  • Experience with Global HR data integration and prior experience with Mergers, Acquisitions, and Divestitures is a plus.
  • Experience with Software engineering best practices, including but not limited to version control (Git/GitHub, TFS, Subversion, etc.), CI/CD (Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, etc.), automated unit testing, Dev Ops is highly beneficial but not required.
  • Full stack development using infrastructure cloud services focused on data engineering and big data analytics (AWS preferred) and cloud-native tools and design patterns (Containers, Serverless, Docker, etc) is a plus and Open-Source data technologies are highly beneficial but not required.
  • Experience with sourcing and modeling data from application APIs and publishing data and analytics services via APIs / Data Services is highly beneficial but not required
  • Experience deploying through an agile methodology and working in a SCRUM or SAFe team is highly beneficial but not required.
  • 5 or more years of experience with one or more general-purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: SQL, Java, Scala, C, C++, C#, Swift/Objective C, Python, or JavaScript
  • Architected end-to-end data pipelines with a major cloud stack is a plus
  • Experience with Semantic technologies and approaches is a plus.
  • Cloud computing, machine learning, text analysis, NLP & Web development experience is a plus
  • Knowledge of Graph Databases (Neo4j, Titan, etc.) and query syntax is a plus

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Extensive computer use, ability to work at a rapid pace, in a virtual environment

title: Data & Analytics Senior Analyst
jobDescription:
The role is part of a brand new global Data Analytics Team, dedicated to managing and developing data acquisition, transformation, loading, storage, and presentation architecture and solution patterns for data platform technologies across the whole CANPACK Group and The Giorgi Companies, which together form Giorgi Global Holding (GGH).

As the DA Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for driving adoption and value of existing data and analytic solutions, initiating new data and analytic solution builds based on business needs, and performing and prototyping ad-hoc analysis for the business that drive insights and business value.

You will:

  • Function as the liaison with the leads in the relevant business roles regarding reporting strategy
  • Engage the business to ensure that the Data and Analytics vision / reporting solutions are properly communicated and adopted
  • Gather business needs and priorities and obtain approvals from the business on key portfolio choices to be made
  • Aid the business in responding to key business questions, requiring detailed knowledge of available data, and requiring strong capability on enterprise reporting tools (e.g., SAP, Power BI, Azure)
  • Stay abreast of ongoing initiatives in the business organizations and plan adaptations to BI solutions to align with changing business needs
  • Maintain documentation for standard reports, metrics, and BI solutions used by different business functions and help onboard/train resources using these playbooks and documentation
  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis on key business questions
  • Prototype solutions to key business questions that use the companys technology stack
  • Act as escalation support for any solution issues that may exist

To be successful in the role, you should:

  • Have 5+ years of relevant experience in a similar role
  • Have strong knowledge of BI/ETL/DW tools, e.g.: SAP BO/BW/SAC, Data Factory, SQL DW, Databricks, Data Factory, Power BI
  • Have experience using Data Science techniques to answer key business questions with data
  • Be comfortable working in a start-up environment, proposing solutions, setting up processes
  • Have university degree in relevant area (i.e., computer science, mathematics, statistics, information systems, or similar)
  • Speak English fluently

title: Senior Data Scientist
jobDescription:
• The ideal teammate is someone who has the skills to unearth insights from large volumes data and communicate those insights in a way that persuades action by senior leaders, product managers, designers, marketers and engineers. Youll use SQL, R, and/or Python often, but you wont be at your desk all day. Part of your job is to improve the data literacy of your stakeholders teaching people when, where, and how to harness the data available.
  • You ll support product teams predominantly in Bangalore, California and Sydney that work hard to improve our Commerce Platform which powers the subscription, billing and payment engine for all of Atlassian customers.
  • On your first day, well expect you to have:
  • A proven experience applying your analytics skills to projects which have had a positive impact on strategic and product roadmap decisions
  • Strong ability to communicate. Explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences, crafting compelling stories, and managing multiple stakeholders
  • Expertise and experience in working with very large data sets in SQL
  • Expertise and experience in modelling and visualisation in a data programming language (Python, R, etc.)
  • Proficiency in one or more analytics and visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Mode, Power BI)
  • Expertise in foundational statistics (data distributions, inferential statistics, probability etc.) and modelling (regression, classification, clustering etc.)
  • Its great, but not required if you have:
  • Familiarity with event-based analytics, data instrumentation and logging
  • Experience in breaking down complex problems using MECE frameworks
  • Experience in designing and analysing experiments that drive key decisions
  • Experience working in a global environment with remote teams
  • Knowledge of and experience with widely-used workplace collaboration tools and integrations between those tools
  • An understanding of the SaaS development, business model and metrics
  • Are an active member of the broader analytics and data science community

title: Sr. Manager - HR & Corporate Functions Data Analytics
jobDescription:
Why Patients Need You

Technology impacts everything we do. Pfizer s digital and data first strategy focuses on implementing impactful and innovative technology solutions across all functions from research to manufacturing. Whether you are digitizing drug discovery and development, identifying solutions, or making our work easier and faster, you will be making a difference to countless lives.

Role Summary

All over the world, Pfizer colleagues are working together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Each position at Pfizer touches and contributes to the success of our business and our world. That s why, as one of the global leaders in the biopharmaceutical industry, Pfizer is committed to seeking out inspired new talent who share our core values and mission of making the world a healthier place.

The Enterprise Data Solutions and Engineering (EDSE), a Pfizer Digital organization, is responsible for the development and management of all data and analytics tools and platforms across the enterprise - from global research and development, to manufacturing, to commercial, to patient care across over 100+ countries. One of the team s top priorities is the advancement of AI/ML enabled analytics and the creation of data solutions that can be leveraged across the enterprise.

As a member of EDSE s Global Business Services & Enabling Functions Data Solutions & Engineering team, you will help to realize Pfizer Digital strategy on the cloud by designing and deploying analytical data platforms, lead high performing teams, and building lasting relationships with our business colleagues. This digital program will produce the data foundation that drives business insights through data science and enterprise BI reporting solutions. This role requires you to lead the solution development and operations support of our HR & Corporate Functions Domains (Human Resources, Learning & Development, Legal, Corporate Affairs, and Compliance). It will require you to design, architect, build and enhance high-visibility data and analytics solutions to support our HR & Corporate Functions Business teams, Business Leaders, and People Managers at Pfizer while leveraging our strategic cloud based infrastructure such as Unified Data Hub, Snowflake, IICS and data visualization products (Tableau) and boutique SaaS People Analytics solutions such as Visier. You will utilize your data analytics and domain experience in the Human Resources field to create innovative data and analytics products that will help our Human Resources team achieve their mission - Unleash the power of our people.

You will be expected to develop and maintain a deep understanding of the Human Resources and Corporate Functions domains you support, especially the analytical needs and opportunities of the Human Resources organization.

You will build and foster relationships so as to be able to work independently and closely with your Digital colleagues as well as key senior level business partners. You will prepare, lead, and facilitate BI/data management discovery workshops, assemble, synthesize and document key learning s, be innovative in your solution concept design and be able to develop and communicate a HR & People Analytics strategic roadmap, which will set the direction for the core solution offerings of Digital Health Medicines and AI as well as the capabilities of Pfizer. You will represent this strategy throughout the solution development life cycle and continue to manage it and keep it relevant to the changing business and technical environments.

Generally, the colleague will also have the responsibility to assist in the architect, design, and building of data models, data pipelines, and data products across various domains to power ML ops platforms, data-driven applications, and software and enable business intelligence solutions. This role will work with the business unit and digital leadership to understand the growing business needs and strategies where the application of AI and ML can yield new products and services and enhance existing processes.

You will also embody Pfizer s OWNIT! Culture values. We seize opportunities to think differently, to take risks and be accountable, and to try something new. This means Pfizer values change-oriented behavior, exemplified through an entrepreneurial, confident, and proactive attitude. Pfizer also values tolerance for taking thoughtful risks to achieve greater success. We advocate and drive long-term, aligned strategies that advance our mission and shape our industry. We confront corrosive, self-serving, and mean-spirited behaviors; its everyones responsibility. We deliver on commitments with speed, decisiveness, and integrity. We invest in candid and constructive debate to ensure each others success using straight talk.

Role Responsibilities

Reporting to the Director - HR Solution Engineering within Pfizer s Digital Health, Medicines, and Artificial Intelligence organization, your major duties and responsibilities are defined below:

Engagement Management

  • Work with clients, client partners, and other stakeholders to develop business justifications, scope of deliverables, RFPs, and explorations of solution options.
  • Perform business and functional analysis activities (e.g., documenting functional and non-functional requirements) for projects as required
  • Establish and maintain client relationships. At all times, know your client base and their business needs.
  • Manages and sets stakeholder expectations
  • Ensures that all customer expectations have been met through the delivery of services or projects
  • Provides a single point of contact and accountability forthe client
  • Secures appropriate resources for projects, engaging with the business, and facilitating service delivery
  • Shapes thinking on how technology solutions support the goals of the business
  • Articulates Digital services and ensures services meet client needs and value expectations, while educating Digital on client needs
  • Aligns Digital services with the current and future needs of the business and its customers while improving the quality of services delivered
  • Analyzing business problems and key issues and developing strategic business analytic implementation plans ( road maps ).
  • Work to drive clarity around people, processes, and data and how they work together to support business needs and challenges.
  • Strong interpersonal, communication, influencing, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Drive best practices and capabilities across business units

Technology Management

  • Provide technical product stewardship for the HR & Corporate Functions People data & analytics platforms. This will require:
    • Serving as a main technical point of contact / SME for L3/L4 inquiries for incidents
    • Lead enhancement initiates whether large or small from ideation to deployment and beyond.
    • Ensure that the platform is stable, data quality is appropriate and that all compliance and best practices are followed during enhancements
  • Defining and driving new EDSE capabilities across Pfizer business units. This will require:
    • Partnering with other Digital organizations to align EDSE strategy with broader Digital Strategies and ensure consistent use
    • Actively monitor & evaluate other company BI & data usage and bring best practices to Pfizer where applicable.
    • Actively monitor & evaluate emerging BI & data management technologies and introduce/present potential benefits to Pfizer.

Project Management/Program Management

  • End-to-end accountability for project success for projects driven out of EDSE in support of these functions.
  • On-time, on-budget, on-quality project delivery; client satisfaction on a project-to-project basis; user satisfaction and effective leadership of teams through influence and expert knowledge of the subject matter.
  • Compliance with Solution Center and other Digital processes and financial procedures is required
  • Assembles and engages project teams
  • Project oversight and status reporting
  • Maintain all project plans and manage all project activities against these plans in accordance with Project Management best practices and Solutions Delivery/Digital procedures
  • Identify, manage, and bring to resolution all project risks/ issues. Escalate major project risks to scope, budget, or timeline to appropriate escalation points in a timely manner
  • Effectively lead and facilitate meetings with clients, vendors, and stakeholders, and conduct productive technology project team status/review meetings
  • Ensure the smooth transition of production solutions to support and maintenance structures within Digital.
  • Review projects when complete against the business case to ensure projected benefits are being realized
  • Ensure all projects are delivered with a minimum of business disruption

Basic Qualifications:

  • Required Education: Bachelors.
  • Preferred Discipline(s): Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Technology Management, Business Management
  • Experience in the Human Resources field with a specific focuson People data and People Data Engineering, Human Resources Reporting, and Workforce Analytics are required.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are required
  • 7+ years of management experience leading project teams and technology delivery functions are required
  • Demonstrated experience in scoping, defining, and managing projects including determining project viability, developing rigorous project estimates, developing, and establishing a project plan, and budget, defining technology solutions, developing RFPs, evaluating vendor responses, negotiating SOWs, and identifying resource requirements is required.
  • Demonstrated project management and solution delivery experience in owning and managing a significant organizational or project budget ($500K to $2MM annually)
  • Demonstrated effective collaboration with teams across an organization to drive processes and operations Knowledge of cloud-based architectures (AWS or Google), cloud analytics products/solutions, and agile methodologies (SCRUM) to enable rapid cycles of development and release of analytics and data products/solutions is required.
  • Experienced with deploying enterprise-level solutions on data preparation and ETL platforms (i.e. Informatica IICS, Informatica Power Center, SnowPipes, Talend, Alteryx, Python, Unix shell scripts, etc.) is required.
  • 5+ years of experience in Data warehousing, data architecture, data modeling, and data transformation is required.
  • Good understanding of deploying and supporting cloud-based data warehouse solutions (Snowflake, Redshift, Spark, Databricks, etc) is required.
  • Knowledge of deploying BI visualization tools such as Tableau or Spotfire, is required.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Preferred: Masters, MBA
  • People Analytics experience using SaaS tools such as Visier, One Model, Perceptyx, Workday Prism Analytics, Workday People Analytics, SAP Success Factors Workforce Analytics is a big plus . Familiarity with cloud/SaaS based Human Capital Management (HCM) systems such as Workday is a big plus .
  • Experience with Software and data engineering best practices, including but not limited to version control (Git, TFS, Subversion, etc.), CI/CD (Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, etc.), automated unit testing, Dev Ops is highly beneficial.
  • Familiarity with the EU Global Data Privacy Regulation (GDPR) and other related international regulations is nice to have. Prior experience with data architecture designs and data engineering development related to the GDPR and data privacy guiding principles such as data minimization, right to be forgotten, etc is beneficial to have.
  • Experience with Global HR data integration and prior experience with Mergers, Acquisitions, and Divestitures is a plus.
  • Experience using agile delivery methodologies such as SAFe is highly beneficial but not required .
  • Full stack development using infrastructure cloud services focused on data engineering and big data analytics (AWS preferred) and cloud-native tools and design patterns (Containers, Serverless, Docker, etc) is a plus and Open-Source data technologies are highly beneficial but not required.
  • Relevant related areas such as data quality, master data management, metadata management, collaboration, and business process managementare beneficial.
  • Experience with sourcing and modeling data from application APIs is beneficial.
  • Experience with data mesh architectures, data virtualization technologies, and real-time data processing architecture and engineering is a plus.
  • Cloud computing, machine learning, sentiment analytics, text analysis, NLP & Web development experience is a plus

title: Data Scientist
jobDescription:
Your Role and Responsibilities

The IBM Z AIOPS team is looking for experienced Data Scientists (Band 8 or Band 9) to help us develop an advanced approach to IT operations analytics for a new ZAIOPS offering.
As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a highly focused, self-managed team that designs, develops and tests cognitive insights into Z Systems workloads and applications. You will collaborate with Designers in applying IBM Design Thinking methodology, subject matter experts in defining impactful insights and the data needed to support them, and a talented development team in implementing the results of your research into a modern analytics application.

You will help develop all the processes from data collection, cleaning, and pre-processing, to training models, exploring prototypes, and deploying them to production. As a key part of our Artificial Intelligence Operations team (AIOps) we want you to help us take the work we do in Machine Learning and backend development to deliver new offerings for our portfolios in ITOM (Information Technology Operations Management) where we help customers drive their digital business by simplifying what they view in their complex environments.
The goal of the project is to leverage ChatOps, foundation models and generative AI to drive new and novel interactions to provide a differentiated user experience to customers in the Z AIOPS tools space.

Who You Are
You.

  • Enjoy the challenge of resolving customers complex business challenges through application of the scientific method.
  • Are curious by nature: creative by default: passionate about data and a data-driven culture.
  • Value teamwork while leading by example.
  • Enjoy sharing your experience with junior data scientists.
  • Remember to always bring empathy to the client, team, design, or task.
  • Have an interest in, understanding of, or experience with Design Thinking.
  • Bring strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Have an interest in, understanding of, or experience with Agile Development.
  • Have an interest in, understanding of, or experience with cognitive computing concepts.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

  • 7+ years of expereince in
  • Probability, Statistics and Linear Algebra
  • Data Science foundation and methodology
  • Data Science, Machine Learning and AI tools
  • Data preparation
  • Data model building
  • Data model selection techniques
  • Data model deployment
  • Data model management
  • Ability to work efficiently with both structured and unstructured data

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

  • Strong Python experience
  • Strong experience with Spark
  • Experience with Scala
  • Experience working with SQL and NoSQL technologies.
  • Programming skills - Python, Go, Java, Perl, Node.js
  • GUI skills Typescript & React, Angular.

title: Big Data Solutions Data Science
jobDescription:
We are seeking a highly skilled data scientist to join our team and lead the implementation of our proprietary Big Data Machine Learning solution in the financial crime space. You will be responsible for identifying and analyzing complex financial data, configuring predictive models, and implementing advanced analytical methods to test and validate output generated by the predictive models. The key responsibilities will include -

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze and interpret complex financial data to identify validate patterns, trends, and anomalies that may indicate fraudulent activity
  • Understand and implement the different configuration techniques across financial crime solution suite
  • Collaborate and communicate data requirements and formats to customers
  • Collaborate with solution engineers, SMEs, product owners, product managers and development teams to get the optimal output for the customer
  • Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance of analytical models and algorithms, and make recommendations for improvements
  • Conduct research and stay up-to-date on industry trends, new technologies, and best practices related to financial crime detection and prevention
  • Communicate insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including senior management

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
  • 5 years of experience in data science, machine learning, or related field, preferably in the financial services industry
  • Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL, and experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases
  • Strong knowledge of statistical modelling techniques, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools

title: Sr Data Scientist, FinTech
jobDescription:
• Work with accounting, engineering, product, data science, compliance and other business stakeholders in mining and analyzing financial and entity-level data to extract key trends and insights.
  • Build effective visualizations to communicate data to key decision-makers.
  • Build models to detect anomalies and resolve financial imbalances; investigate and resolve data discrepancies between systems.
  • Understand critical interdependencies across functions and divisions, and grasp the short and long-term trade-offs of business decisions.
  • Explore Fintech systems/data to proactively identify and initiate process improvements for cost savings and efficiencies.
  • Build end to end data pipelines and self serving dashboards. Automate whatever you can!
  • Plan and lead complex projects, prioritize tasks and map stakeholders appropriately
  • Be a trusted advisor to Product Management and business leadership.
  • Conduct feasibility studies to analyze the impact of proposed product changes.
  • Communicate your findings to cross-functional peers and management.
  • Get a deep understanding about the FinTech systems and data flows involved; document and train internal personnel to institutionalize the learnings of the data analytics practice.

---- What You Will Need ----

  • Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative field.
  • 5+ years experience as a Product Analyst, Sr. Data Analyst, or other type of data analysis-focused functions
  • Advanced SQL expertise
  • Experience with either Python or R for data analysis
  • Basic knowledge of statistics
  • Proven ability to wrangle large datasets, extracting insights from data, and summarizing learnings/takeaways.
  • Experience with Excel and some dashboarding/data visualization (i.e. Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar)
  • Demonstrated aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data
  • Excellent understanding of statistical principles backed by an academic foundation
  • Ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies for data collection and analysis
  • Ability to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail
  • Ability to work in a self-guided manner
  • Ability to mentor, coach and develop junior team members
  • Superb communication and organization skills
  • Prior experience within the finance industry is a plus

title: Junior Data Scientist
jobDescription:
Within the Corporate Solutions Data Science Centre of Excellence, we are looking for a Junior Data Scientist.

In this role, you will have following fundamental responsibilities:
  • Work alongside a technically sophisticated team of data scientists and data engineers within our Bangalore hub.
  • Build up and maintain data science best practices, standards and appropriate model governance. Inspiring others to raise minimum standards to a new level
  • Develop and deploy advanced machine learning and AI models according to the established data science best practices

  • You are open-minded, intellectually curious and enjoy continually learning from a variety of sources.
  • Ideally, youve got experience in the insurance industry or tech company

title: Data Scientist
jobDescription:
As part of the core data science team, you will be responsible for developing models, and implementing algorithms that generate revenue and profit lift making our customers successful.

What you would do as a Data Scientist

  • Work on the data science roadmap for our flagship Price Performance Management product.
  • Work with large-scale retail data of Fortune 50 companies and developing pricing, demand forecasting and inventory models.
  • Apply out-of-the-box, advanced algorithms to complex problems in real-time systems
  • Perform rapid prototyping of experimental solutions and develop robust, maintainable production systems in statistical languages such as R/Python.
  • Drive productization of techniques to be made available to a wide range of retail customers

Skills and Experience:

  • Modeling - You should be familiar with ML concepts and algorithms; an understanding of the internals and pros/cons of models is required. You should have good grasp over concepts of probability and combinatorics.
  • Algorithms and Data Structures - You should have strong fundamentals of data structures and commonly used algorithms, an understanding of correctness and runtime analysis, familiarity with space-time-accuracy tradeoffs;
  • Programming - You should have hands-on programming skills and write good quality code for a given requirement in R/Python. Knowledge of SQL is required.
  • Familiarity with distributed computing architecture like Spark, Map-Reduce paradigm and Hadoop will be an added advantage.
  • Problem-solving approach; Communication and articulation skills; Inclination and ability to pick up new techniques/technologies.
  • Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or Maths/Stats from a reputed college with 2+ years of experience in solving data science problems that has driven value to customers data.

title: Deputy Manager Data Science and Digital technologies
jobDescription:
This role would primarily focus on developing Data architecture, data engineering, advanced analytics, AI/ML models, and process digitalization. The right candidate needs minimum 6 years of experience - inclusive of People Management and cut-throat Technical Skills.

Added Responsibilities

  • Advanced Analytics : The candidate would be responsible to set up Advanced Analytics. He/She would work with cross-functional teams and bring industry standard AIML use-cases to BD Life Sciences. He/She might be required to travel to Plants and other BD facilities to identify the right AIML use cases.

  • Data Architecture and engineering: The candidate would be responsible for leading the data architecture and engineering aspects across multiple initiatives.

  • People Management : The candidate should have good interpersonal skills and might be required to handle a team of upto 5 associates currently.

  • Project Management /Analytics Support: Work with leadership to derive Integrated Supply Chain transformation through innovative analytics. Draft project plan and evangelize with stakeholders across the organization for feedback and approval. Develop an in-depth understanding of business performance and generate strategic insights to influence decision making

  • Operational Excellence

  • Develop and standardize analytical tools, frameworks, and processes, to up-level and democratize analytically grounded decision making at all levels of the business

  • Challenge the status quo to advance and evolve how BD thinks about and executes solutions across Supply Chain, Marketing, Operations, and other areas of the business

  • Stakeholder People Management:

  • Partner present to senior BD Leadership (VP/GMs, Sr Directors, Directors, Leaders etc.) across Supply Chain, Operations, Finance Global Marketing

  • Manage deadlines, timelines, and employee schedules

  • Leading new resource hiring, Performance review, Career Planning, etc.

Desired Candidate Profile:

  • Minimum of bachelor s degree Top Tier University graduate with background in math/engineering; having at least 6 years of Work experience . Self-motivated, curious, autonomous and willing to learn . MBA or equivalent degree from top colleges would be a plus.

  • Experience in Power Automate, Power App, Power BI, Microsoft Azure is required

  • Experience in Analytics data modelling, visualization ( Python/R, Power Query , Power BI, SQL, Visual Basic ) would be must.

  • Carrying out preprocessing of structured and unstructured data

  • Statistics - Good applied statistical skills, including knowledge of statistical tests, distributions, regression, maximum likelihood estimators, etc. Proficiency in statistics is essential for data-driven companies

  • Machine Learning - good knowledge of machine learning methods like k-Nearest Neighbors, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests

  • Understanding of Time Series analytics/Statistical demand forecasting will be good. Hand-on experience in algorithms like Regression, ARIMA, SARIMA, Prophet, etc.

  • Strong Math Skills (Multivariable Calculus and Linear Algebra) - understanding the fundamentals of Multivariable Calculus and Linear Algebra is important as they form the basis of a lot of predictive performance or algorithm optimization techniques

  • Experience or understanding of Supply Chain Management, Order to Cash process is strong plus. Knowledge of supply chain metrics like Forecast accuracy, Back Order, Inventory, etc. with strong communication presentation Skills.

  • People Management experience would be plus

  • Experience and knowledge of ERP, SAP systems and Business Intelligence tools.

  • Candidate should be willing cope with some stress and able to prioritize with help of management

  • Comfortable manipulating large amount of data

title: ML Engineer
jobDescription:
Skills & Knowledge


Apache Spark MLlib:


Databricks is built on top of Apache Spark, which includes a machine leaming library called MLlib. You should have a strong understanding of MLlib's algorithms and APIs, including supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.


Databricks MLflow:


Databricks includes an open-source machine leaming platform called ML.flow, which provides tools for tracking experiments, packaging and deploying models, and collaborating with other team members. You should be familiar with MLflow's components and how to use them to manage machine learning workflows.


Distributed Computing:


Databricks is designed to handle large-scale, distributed computing workloads, so you should have experience working with distributed systems and parallel computing. You should be familiar with techniques such as data partitioning, shuffling, and caching, as well as how to optimize performance and scale ML workflows in a distributed environment.


Data Preparation:


Databricks supports building complex data pipelines using tools such as Apache Airflow and Apache NiFi. You should understand how to use these tools to create scalable, fault-tolerant data pipelines.


Model Deployment:


Databricks provides various options for deploying machine learning models, such as MLflow models and Azure Machine Learning. You should be familiar with these options and how to deploy models to production environments.


Software Development:


Databricks is a cloud-based big data processing platform. You should have programming skills and a basic understanding of software development techniques to

develop applications/solutions in a test-driven or objective-driven development environment.


Cloud Infrastructure:


Databricks is typically deployed on cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. You should have a good understanding of cloud infrastructure concepts such as virtual machines, storage, and networking, as well as the specific services offered by the cloud provider.


Collaboration & Sharing:


Databricks provides various collaboration and sharing features, such as notebooks and Git integration. You should be familiar with these features and how to use them to collaborate with other team members and manage ML workflows.


Overall, a machine learning engineer working with Databricks should have a strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques and experience working with large-scale distributed systems and cloud infrastructure. They should also be comfortable working with programming languages such as Python, Scala, and SQL, as well as ML libraries and frameworks such as MLlib and TensorFlow.

title: Senior Data Research Analyst
tagsAndSkills: Capital Market,GIT,Python Development,Fixed Income,statistical analyses,software testing,data research,data analytics
jobDescription:
Position: Senior Data Research Analyst
Department: Fixed Income Team

Team: Fixed Income Engineering
Shift: UK


Morningstar is seeking a Senior Data Research Analyst to join the Fixed Income Data & Analytics team. The Senior Data Research Analyst is part of the team responsible for developing critical data and analytics solutions in fixed income that will be used by Morningstars entire product landscape. We offer room for growth and a high level of personal responsibility in a challenging environment. As a successful candidate, you will take an active part in the development of new data and analytics solutions that address real client needs.

In this role, you will be asked to gather and interpret data requirements, perform research and analysis, as well as to work on data mappings from multiple sources. Based on financial engineering knowledge, the Senior Data Research Analyst will write Python backend engines systems that will be integrated and implemented by development teams.

This position would also be expected to lead key fixed income data and analytics projects within Morningstar that require partnering with product and other data teams in order to develop the fixed income roadmap at Morningstar.


Responsibilities:


  • Hands-on development of backend Python systems will be an integral part of the responsibilities
  • Research, design, execute, test and document fixed income engines
  • Liaise between business, implementation, and fixed income teams
  • Develop new solutions to improve Morningstar product offerings
  • Developing insights on large scale data requiring data cleaning and statistical analysis as needed
  • Communicating results to rating analysts, senior management and other key stakeholders

Requirements


  • A minimum of 2 to 3 years experience in backend Python development (beyond simple jupyter notebooks)
  • Highly proficient with PyCharm (or other full suite IDE)
  • In-depth knowledge of Object Oriented / Functional Programming principles
  • Demonstrated dedication to detailed code documentation and testing (Pytest, unittest)
  • Experience with Git
  • At least basic financial engineering skills and experience
  • At least basic knowledge of fixed income markets and securities
  • Highly proficient with SQL (MySQL, Postgres, MariaDB, MS Access etc)
  • Highly proficient with database design, creation, population and trouble-shooting
  • Ability to follow the data from ingestion to client facing products
  • Able to work under tight deadlines and handle pressure during peak seasons.
  • Exhibit flexibility as per business requirement
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Committed team player

Education


  • At least a BSc in Math, Physics, Engineering, Stats, CompSci, or Quant Finance Highly Valued
  • In-depth knowledge of Fixed Income and Capital Markets
  • CFA Pursuing or progress towards completion
  • Independent personal Git projects (with link). Any subjects of interest.

Please share your updated resumes on pooja.sheth@morningstar.com

title: Technical Lead - Data Science
tagsAndSkills: Database design,ETL design,Data Science,etl,data cleansing,technical leadership,mongodb,big data
jobDescription:
Position Summary

The Data Engineer III plays a Lead technical role in an AgileScrum based Data Science team working in a development environment designing and maintaining data stores that will be used for analytical processing andor data warehouse. The Data Engineer III is a subject matter expert in Hadoop, Vertica and related technologies. This individual is responsible for maintaining data integrity, data modeling, performance tuning, and advanced administration of Big Data, and Data-mart systems.

Key Performance Competencies

- AdaptableFlexible

- Technical Knowledge

- Communication Skills

- Problem Solving

- Initiative

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

- Selecting and integrating any Big Data tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities

- Implementing ETL process using Talend, and Python scripts

- Monitoring performance and advising any necessary infrastructure changes

- Defining data retention policies

- Data modeling, database optimization, understanding and implementation of schemas, and the ability to interpret and write complex SQL queries

- Responsible for the administration, performance and security of existing databases and the analysis, design, and creation of new databases

- Proactively monitor and tune systems, databases and BI toolssoftware for optimum performance and capacity constraints

- Analyze user requirements and design functional specifications for BI front-end applications

- Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure

- Promote and educate BI usage and benefits across the organization

- Evaluate and make recommendations for databasedata warehouse components, including hardware, database management systems, ETL software, BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.

- Mentor junior database engineers

Knowledge Skills Required :

- Working experience with integration of data from multiple data sources

- Working experience with NoSQL databases, such as HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB

- Working experience with various ETL techniques and frameworks

- Experience with various messaging systems, such as Kafka or RabbitMQ

- Experience with Big Data ML toolkits, such as Mahout, SparkML, or H2O

- Good understanding of Lambda Architecture, along with its advantages and drawbacks

- Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles

- Management of Hadoop cluster, with all included services

- Ability to identifysolve any ongoing issues with Hadoop cluster

- Proficiency with Hadoop v2, MapReduce, HDFS

- Experience with Spark

- Experience with building stream-processing systems, using solutions such as Storm or Spark-Streaming

- Good knowledge of Big Data querying tools, such as Pig, Hive, and Impala

- Strong attention to detail

Education, Training and Experience

- Bachelors degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field, or demonstrated equivalent experience

- 6+ years of database design in a development andor production environment

- 4+ years ETL design and implementations

- 2+ years in data cleansing

- One or more of the following certifications highly desirable: MCITP: Database Administrator certification, MCSE: Data Platforms, MCSE: BI

Compensation

- To be decided on a case-by-case basis, pegged with the best in the industry.

title: Data Science Evangelist
jobDescription:
Do you feel passionately about solving problems through data Have you spent 2+ years solving business problems through data

Do you aspire to take data science to millions of people out there Can the leader in you make people follow data science out of sheer passion Would you enjoy helping people solve problems with out expecting any thing in return

If the answer to all the questions is yes look no more. Analytics Vidhya is looking for evangelists who can carry and deliver their baton to the world.

What should you expect
  • A team of best data scientists and thought leaders from industry.
  • Disciplined entrepreneurship within team. Each person is owner of his own work you set the milestones, the pace and the achievements.
  • High standards, deep passion for data science and a commitment to find out ways to make things work.
Who can fill in the shoes

This role is best suited for:

  • Person with 2+ years of experience in data science. The person should have prior experience with practical data science applications and use cases.
  • Person who loves problem solving through data. She/He should be able to do things hands on by himself or guide a team of data scientists to solve a problem.
  • A person with deep experience in tools like SAS / R / Python / Julia / Matlab and machine learning / predictive modeling techniques/ Machine Learning Algorithms.
  • Strong problem solving and communication skills (English).
  • An avid reader.
What is the role

Being a startup, the role would evolve over time. But, here are a few things you can expect:

  • Creating problems for our hackathons by working closely with the clients
  • Continuously learning new skills and evangelizing them with in our community
  • Defining and leading our strategy in making data science easy and accessible to all
  • Leading industry events, meetups, webinars and competitions
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences and other business outcomes.
Where is the role based

We would love to have you in our office in Gurgaon.

title: Junior Data Analyst
jobDescription:
Junior Data Analyst


TMS Global are a wholly owned subsidiary of DS Smith PLC, a FTSE100 listed multi-national packaging and display manufacturing business. TMS Global specialise in the outsourcing of retail display, print and packaging and are active in 97 markets globally and our TMS family consists of just over 300 people who are spread internationally across APAC, LATAM, EMEA and NA.


TMSs Global family is growing, and we have a fantastic opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to join our Shared Service centre team based in Gurgaon. Working to support the wider business this role will be required to work Europe aligned shifts and offers hybrid working. In this position you will be required to be in the office 2 times per week.


About the role


As the Junior Data Analyst you will be Responsible for taking a brief from reporting manager and business stakeholders, to extract data and build excel based reports. Using Power query, Advanced Excel formulae, VBA and well versed with Advanced Excel data connection and formulae. Create report in excel based on the requirement.

This is both an internal and customer facing role, the JDA will demonstrate the ability to communicate and deliver effectively across multiple projects and against tight deadlines, whilst maintaining the professional reputation of the department. The JDA will also be responsible for recurring reports on monthly cycles with agreed SLAs for the business.


Some of the responsibilities you will be doing Day to Day:


  • Work on Recurring and Adhoc reporting request in Advanced Excel
  • Able to fetch and transform data using Power Query and VBA
  • Preferred Analytics background candidate
  • The production and distribution of data reporting from within PMS (procurement platform) in accordance with defined protocols and standard operating procedures.
  • Providing help desk support to users with reporting queries.
  • Defining and scoping change requests
  • Excel Modelling for analysis of data warehouse
  • Build Analytical Pricing Models to support the business commercial requirements.
  • Use of Power Query Editor to build automated reporting for transactional outputs

About you


If you have completed a relevant degree in computer science or have some relevant work experience and looking to start / progress your career within D&A, this could be a great fit for you.


To qualify for the role, you must have:

  • 0-3 years’ experience in a relevant field, or degree in Data & Analytics / Reporting
  • Technical skills - Advanced Excel, Power query, VBA, Basic SQL, Power BI, beneficial
  • Experience of a Data Analysis and Administration within a commercially focussed environment
  • Able to work from office 2x per week and to Europe aligned shifts. ( 1pm-9pm IST / 2pm-10pm IST)
  • Fluent in English

Application Process:
Please submit a copy of your current CV

title: Sr.Data Analyst
jobDescription:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our team. The candidate would be joining our service delivery team. You will be responsible for analyzing complex  datasets, managing large volumes of data efficiently for analytics purposes, and maintaining data integrity by establishing source-of-truth.


We are expecting from Sr. Data Analyst : 

  • Developing complex data analysis, methodologies, and predictive data models for improvising business sales performance
  • Developing and leading projects that include a variety of advanced qualitative and quantitative analytic assignments
  • Build visualization through a set of recurring reports that serves tracking of campaigns, monitoring KPIs, and supporting real-time analytics
  • Providing business insights and recommendations that will eventually help the technical team to plan further feature improvements
  • Conduct Exploratory Data Analysis, build upon business segmentation, and more that leads to actionable insights
  • Extensive experience in designing high-impact experiments, that are supported by indicative data patterns
  • Translate complex data insights and present them to internal executives and clients to support decision making
  • Collaborate with other teams in the organization, such as data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders
  • Document the outcome of data analysis and ensure they are understandable and maintainable by other team members
  • Keep up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in data analytics

What are our projects require to have :

  • Experience with SQL, Tableau, Power BI, Advanced Excel
  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages is added advantage like R, Python
  • Experience in popular utilized analytics approach like:
  • Conducting exploratory data analysis
  • Developing segmentation
  • Designing performance score
  • Designing A/B tests for experimentation
  • Tracking and measuring experiments and A/B tests
  • Experience with cloud-based data technologies such as Big Query, and Snowflake is good-to-have
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

jobDescription:
Job Description:
Data Scientist required to help in data wrangling and analysis of chemometric data obtained from field experiments/ test runs and develop chemometric models for chemical component analysis.
He/she will work closely with

a) the business team to understand requirements and goals of the project;
b) analyze data and develop the required models to solve for the problem statement;

c) work with the team to push the model to production to work in real-time and gather feedback to improve output

d) be responsible for data and model maintenance and version control
Roles and Responsibilities
1. Analyse and evaluate data quality
2. Translate business requirements to problem statements
3. Research and review relevant model practices that are currently in use
4. Design experiments to test hypotheses pertaining to business problem, in order to determine
the right data metrics for assessment
5. Build statistical models for prediction to solve the same
6. Validation of resultant model and determination of prediction error limits
7. Establish sample size requirements for prediction of chemical composition in volume analysis,
based on developed models
8. Convert findings to reports (either ppt or word) that are crisp and brief
9. Model versioning and control in git
10. Participate and explore other problems to solve in the domain with the given data, if possible
Skills required
1. Require candidate with 18 months+ work experience in Data science and analysis
2. PhD/ Masters in Mathematics and/or Statistics background preferred, should be familiar with
Design of Experiments (DoE)
3. Understanding of statistics and probability fundamentals and ability to weave domain
knowledge from business with statistics to arrive at the right solution
4. Coding skills in R/ Python with an understanding of functions used for statistical analysis, and
interfacing with databases. Familiarity with relevant libraries used for data manipulation and
model building.
5. Good knowledge of MS Excel should be able to perform simple operations and analysis on
excel to present and explain to stakeholders.

6. Strong foundation in Probability and Statistics, Regression analysis
7. Strong knowledge in distributions - formulae for Poisson, Normal, Binomial, Exponential,
Geometric distributions, t-test, chi-square test, p value, F value.
8. Good communication skills
9. Good in problem solving and preparing flow diagrams for the same
10. Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, power BI is appreciated. Should have sound knowledge/ grasp of data visualization fundamentals

title: Data Scientist
jobDescription:
We are looking for Data Scientist with Advanced Statistical Modeler with 3-5 years experience in building and implementing predictive models.




The ideal candidate should have the following background and experience in the following areas:



  • Advanced skills in developing predictive models for sales and marketing analytics such as pricing, marketing optimization, demand forecasting, etc.

  • Detailed understanding and experience in using US based Point of Sale (POS) data from IRI and/or AC Nielsen is an important requirement

  • Experience in building models for AI and Machine Learning such as neural networks, LSTM, etc.

  • Advanced programming skills in Python and experience in building predictive models using these programs

  • Experience in building code that can be implemented in a technological product

  • Deep understanding of statistical modeling and experience in practical implementation of causal models such as regression and time-series

  • Experience in analyzing very large datasets, cleansing them and get them ready for modeling – candidates who have used point of sale (POS) data are a huge plus

  • Broad understanding of business questions related to sales and marketing analytics and ability to connect the analytics to answer these questions

  • Master’s degree in Statistics or related disciplines from a reputed institution

In addition to the above technical qualifications, the ideal candidate should be a team-player and thought leader with the ability to create a best-in-class analytics and technology environment. S/he should be highly flexible and willing to work and thrive in a dynamic fast-changing start-up environment.


The selected candidate will be an essential part of the team of a fast-growing organisation. Reporting to the Chief Product Officer.

- Design and implement end-to-end solutions using Machine Learning, Optimization, or other advanced technologies and manage live deployments

- Construct and deliver written reports of the analytic findings in a variety of formats (reports, PPT, including visualization of data and findings), formulating recommendations, and effectively presenting the results to potential non-analytic audiences

Qualifications :

- Master's or Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Statistics, Economics or related analytics field from top-tier universities with strong record of achievement

- 2-4 years' experience with solid analytical skills and an entrepreneurial, hands-on approach

- Preferred domain expertise in Retail, Media, CPG, Sports & Logistics

- Experience in Machine Learning or NLP, such as Scikit-Learn, SpaCity, Pytorch, or Spark NLP

- Strong coding experience in Python, R, SAS

- Prior experience in management consulting and/or analytics based consulting is desirable

- Very strong analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to research and make decisions based on the day-to-day and complex customer problems required.

title: Senior Data Scientist
jobDescription:
Position Overview:

Lead / Senior Data scientist will be responsible for design, development and integration of Al solutions aligned with roadmap and business requirements.


Responsibilities:

  • Deep implementation using Python in end-to-end data science process - data curation, data transformation, regression, classification, clustering, recommender system and text analytics.
  • Production deployed models and troubleshooting issues with a variety of production data.
  • Integration design of python API for seamless interaction with consuming business processes.
  • DB design for ML requirements.
  • Design workers process job services to handle the queue of model training and prediction requests.
  • Driving a small to medium size Al team on successful delivery of Al solutions.

The Ideal Candidate:

  • Should have 3 to 5 years in Al production deployed models with overall 5 to 7 years of experience in the IT industry.
  • Well versed in machine learning with deep implementation experience using Python in end-to-end data science process.
  • Should have experience in DB design for ML requirements.
  • Good to have knowledge on production model monitoring and ML-ops framework.

title: Senior Data Scientist
jobDescription:
• Utilise an advanced knowledge level of the Data Science Toolbox to participate in the entire Data Science Project Lifecycle and execute end-to-end Data Science project
  • Work end-to-end on Data Science developments contributing to all aspects of the project lifecycle
  • Understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions
  • Analyse and link complex datasets so that they may be learned from or optimised
  • Scientifically analyse and evaluate the effectiveness of different approaches to guide future development and track the value created by the team
  • Build mathematical models on top of big data architectures to gain deep insights into opportunities to improve the customer experience and the Tesco business
  • Partner with technology teams to productionize developments
  • Communicate complex solutions in a clear understandable way to non-experts
  • Promote data science and promote company across the external Data Science community

Other non technical skills

  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills and clearly articulate your ideas.
  • Learn new areas/disciplines quickly.
  • Are a team player and work collaboratively with other members of the team.
  • Seek help and guidance when appropriate.
  • Are self-organised and can plan your work in line with the team plan and priorities.
  • Take an active part in the Data Science community building and knowledge sharing with peers.
  • Demonstrate empathy and listening skills to understand the needs of your stakeholders and customers and strong persuasion skills to influence others.
  • Encourage collaboration and communication between teams.
  • Keep up-to-date with data trends and developments showing a strong interest and commitment to your work and Data Science
  • Have great presentation skills and can present your ideas/ thoughts/plans with clarity and confidence.
  • Demonstrate ownership responsiveness and commitment towards your work.
  • Demonstrate strong data-based decision-making skills especially when multiple trade-offs are involved and fast decision-making is required.
  • Have great coaching skills and mentor junior colleagues and peers in your team.
  • Confidently and competently represent the team when needed.
  • Collaborate with external suppliers and solution providers.
  • Use the leadership skills to encourage and get the best out of the people you work with.

Customer Commercial & Critical Thinking

  • Have an analytical thought process and ability to process complex information.
  • Understand key user personas customers and stakeholders for your project and their pain points really well.
  • Keep customers as focus of analysis insight and recommendation.
  • Help define business objectives/customer needs by capturing the right requirements from the right customers.
  • Can take defined problems and identify resolution paths and opportunities to solve them; which you validate by defining hypotheses and driving experiments
  • Have an understanding of the commercial impact of your recommendations and insight
  • Can identify unstructured problems and articulate opportunities to form new analytics project ideas
  • Functional (e.g.quantitative techniques)
  • Contribute to all aspects of the Data Science project lifecycle
  • Understand and monitor data quality to improve confidence in the data used for analysis
  • Use and understand the key performance indicators (KPIs) and diagnostics to measure performance against business goals
  • Compile integrate and analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends expose new opportunities and answer ongoing business questions
  • Execute hypothesis-driven analysis to address business questions issues and opportunities
  • Build validate and manage advanced models (e.g. explanatory predictive) using statistical and/or other analytical methods
  • Are familiar working within Agile Project Management methodologies / structures
  • Analyse results using statistical methods and work with senior team members to make recommendations to improve customer experience and business results
  • Have the ability to conceptualize formulate prototype and implement algorithms to capture customer behavior and solve business problems
  • Analyse results using statistical methods to make recommendations to improve customer experience and business results
  • Skilled at managing processing and optimising performance and reliability of automated data streams and analytical workflows

Domain

  • Advanced knowledge level of the Data Science Toolbox
  • Familiar with configuring Data Science analytics environments (technology software etc)
  • Understanding of ETL principles (Data munging joins etc)
  • Experience working in Hadoop / Big Data environments and common Data Science toolkits

title: Data Scientist / Sr. Data Scientist
jobDescription:
Qualification: Bachelor s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related discipline

Experience: 7 plus years with 3-5 years of experience in statistical analysis or data science.

Skills: Python, R, PHP, Hadoop/Big data, Data Science/Data Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Algorithms and probability engines

  • Experience manipulating large datasets and using databases with experience in general purpose programming language such as Hadoop.
  • Ability to develop solutions to loosely defined business or research problems by leveraging pattern detection over large data sets.
  • Experience using machine learning algorithms.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with technical and non-technical internal and stakeholders.
  • Ability to organize, analyze and correlate data information.

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Construct advanced predictive models, algorithms and probability engines to support data analysis or product functions; verify model and algorithm effectiveness based on real-world results.
  • Design experiments and methodologies to generate and collect data for business use.
  • Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as sensors, open data, and social media feeds.
  • Design experiments, test hypotheses, and build models to explore complex business and safety science systems.
  • Conduct data analyses using traditional and complex statistical methods. Design algorithms and implements software to perform analyses.
  • Aggregate, transform and integrate multiple data sets to test hypothesis, model complex systems and identify patterns. Prepare and analyze program/model output to allow for efficient data analysis.
  • Transform complex data and results into creative graphs, tables, charts and other graphics to present and/or share the data in a compelling and concise manner.
  • Write methodology, analysis and data insights for research papers, proposals and presentations. Synthesize all aspects of a data science project to lead non-technical audiences through the goals, methods and implications of the project.
  • Work with business leaders and researchers to suggest other projects and initiatives that will advance the organizations goals.

title: Advisory - Deals - FDD - Data Analytics - Manager
jobDescription:
As a Manager, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

  • Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.
  • Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.
  • Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.
  • Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.
  • Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
  • Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firms/clients expectations.
  • Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.
  • Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.
  • Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.
  • Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.
  • Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.

  • Provide data architecture and technical delivery guidance to the Data Analytics team.

  • Implement enhancements to a central Datawarehouse solution for the firm.

  • Lead an agile DevOps software team to create innovative applications.

  • Lead a team specialized in Azure Data warehousing and MSBI stack.

  • Oversee team members tasks and upskill the team members in the tools.

  • Analyze requirements, estimate production time, design solutions, code solutions, test solutions, and document work.

  • Assist the team members and manage the end-to-end deliverable.

  • Mentor team of Data engineers/Azure cloud engineers and act as an SME.

  • Ensure adherence to best practices, management processes, and technical constraints.

  • Design and conduct training on Azure technologies like ADF, Synapse, AAS etc.

  • Assist in the drafting of business cases, project plans, test reports, risk assessments, and other project specific documentation.

  • Acts as client liaison in the development of application functional documentation, including technical specs document, technical data sheets, operational manuals, and training materials.

  • Must be functional in a coach/player role.

Education and Work-Experience

  • Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or similar engineering discipline.

  • Minimum 12+ years of relevant work experience in agile/scrum software development, BI development settings with a focus on developing projects using Data warehousing and cloud environments (e.g. Azure)

  • Strong Experience in Microsoft Development Toolkit (SSIS, SSAS, Azure Data Factory, Visual Studio)

  • Experience with Databricks

  • Experience with NoSQL, Relational, Multimodal and Graph databases.

  • Experience in designing and implementing User Interfaces at an Enterprise Level.

  • Strong system architecture and design experience to include deploying production enterprise applications in cloud environments that use AI/ML.

  • Experience with scripting and programming languages in Python, R and Java is preferable

  • Experience in Design Thinking workshops and all related activities, designing solutions that balance user needs, commercial interests, and technological constraints, and including design strategy, service design, design research.

  • Experience planning and executing customer design projects through holistic understanding of problem areas, iterative solution design, executive stakeholder management, and integration of business and technical experts.

  • Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research and synthesizing to provide insights, identify opportunities, and generate conceptual frameworks.

Skills

  • Strong experience with Azure/MSBI data engineering environment

  • Experience with ADF, Synapse, AAS etc.

  • Experience with SSIS, SSAS, Power BI.

  • Bachelor or master s degree in engineering or IT discipline.

  • Experience of handling team of minimum 5+ resources.

title: Data Governance Lead - Sr. Manager Level
jobDescription:
• Joining a rapidly growing organization with an environment that fosters personal and professional development

  • Opportunity to learn new tools and technology. Participate in building a solid data driven foundation for the organization.

  • Work on breakthrough data and analytics products and projects that will create significant value for our clients

  • Opportunity to make a difference to the world by being a part of the health and benefits industry. A chance to work with Industry leaders, global clients and access to latest trends in the industry.

Roles and Responsibilities will include -

  • Understanding the data landscape and respective regulatory requirements throughout the organization, working with regions to overcome bottlenecks

  • Building a data governance framework that leverages data governance management tools and technology to establish governance policies, standards and procedures

  • Working with technology, digital and compliance teams to ensure data readiness for downstream analytics

  • Partnering with appropriate third parties as necessary for data acquisition

  • Driving data stewardship and ownership with alignment from regional and global stakeholders to manage the lifecycle of our clients data. Leading and grooming business data stewards to ensure accuracy of data capture, maximizing data observability and value

  • Establish a measurement process to track data governance progress against a data capability maturity model.

  • Providing recommendations and guidelines for periodic data quality checks and drive governance to ensure long-term data trust and delivery of meaningful analytics

  • Aligning with data engineering, data analytics, data science, and analytics operations work to ensure consistency across work streams.

  • Leading data governance steercos/programs across regions

What you need to have:

  • 12 years of experience in the data domain with a proven track record of successfully deploying data governance, operations and master data management

  • Bachelors Degree In Information Sciences/ Engineering, Masters Degree or equivalent

  • Strong understanding of data platforms, data engineering, data integration, data reporting/analytics, MDM and Metadata management tools.

  • Familiarity with data science and data wrangling process. Familiarity with languages such as Python, R, SAS , SQL etc. Familiarity with big data tools such as Hive, Spark, Hadoop etc.

  • Experience working with Data Owners, stewards and helping business teams shape these critical Data roles

  • Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and have influence across organizational boundaries through excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Highly skilled in communication and project management

What makes you stand out:

  • Experience of Healthcare/ Insurance industry

  • Experience of working with senior stakeholders across the globe

  • Demonstrated experience of setting data governance processes for analytics through use of right technology
